items.title: 7-Day Tone Your Upper Body Challenge
items.content_excerpt: Home » Fitness » 7-Day Tone Your Upper Body Challenge Fitness 7-Day Tone Your Upper Body Challenge by Erin Miller Pin Facebook Email Shares 328 Published: May 3, 2019 Last Updated: April 12, 2021 Sleeker, sexier, and stronger than ever, in only 7 days! Do you dream of having slim and sexy arms, a perky chest, a sleek back, and a tight core? This 7-day tone your upper body challenge will help make that dream a reality! Aside from improving your appearance, this challenge will also increase your strength and boost your confidence to new levels! This challenge utilizes three separate workouts that will isolate each muscle so you’re left with a perfectly sculpted upper body. You only need a few pieces of equipment to complete this workout, which means it can be performed at the gym or from the comfort of your own home. Before we jump into the challenge, we need to make sure that you understand the important role that diet plays in toning up. If you’re not eating properly, all your hard work will be for naught. With that being said, you should focus on incorporating Foods That Will Help You Tone-Up into your daily eating plan. Combining a healthy diet with the workouts below will allow you to reach your goals faster than ever. Related: The 30-Day High-Protein, Low-Carb Challenge 7-Day Tone Your Upper Body Challenge What you need: an interval timer / a towel, yoga mat , or bench / a chair / a light set of dumbbells (3-8 lbs.) / a medium set of dumbbells (10-15 lbs.) / an exercise ball What to do: On days 1, 3, 4, 6, and 7, perform 3 to 5 rounds of 10 repetitions. Rest for 1 minute in between each round. On day 2 and 5, complete the designated core workout. You will find instructional videos for each exercise at the bottom of this post. Day 1, 4, and 7 Chest: Flat Dumbbell Chest Press Back: Bent-over Dumbbell Rows Shoulder: Overhead Dumbbell Shoulder Press Triceps: Dumbbell Triceps Kickbacks Biceps: Dumbbell Bicep Curls Day 2 and 5 Core: 20-Minute Core Strength Workout Day 3 and 6 Chest: Dumbbell Chest Fly Back: Dumbbell Rear Fly Shoulder: Alternating Dumbbell Front to Side Raise Triceps: Chair Dips Biceps: Dumbbell Hammer Curls Instructional Videos Day 1, 4, and 7 Flat Dumbbell Chest Press Bent-over Dumbbell Rows Overhead Dumbbell Shoulder Press Dumbbell Triceps Kickbacks Dumbbell Bicep Curls Day 3 and 6 Dumbbell Chest Fly Dumbbell Rear Fly Alternating Dumbbell Front to Side Raise Chair Dips Dumbbell Hammer Curls While this challenge is only seven days long, you can feel free to perform it for as many weeks as you’d like! After all, the longer you spend training, the better your results will be! items.title: 4-Week Exercise Plan for Absolute Beginners with Calendar
items.content_excerpt: Home » Fitness » 4-Week Exercise Plan for Absolute Beginners with Calendar Fitness 4-Week Exercise Plan for Absolute Beginners with Calendar by Erin Miller Pin Facebook Email Shares 3.7k Published: April 30, 2019 Last Updated: December 16, 2021 Get fit in 4 weeks with this fun, effective, step-by-step workout plan for beginners! More often than not, the beginning of your fitness journey will feel overwhelming and challenging. If this sounds familiar, trust us: you’re not alone. One of our main goals here at SkinnyMs is to make the fitness process as simple and stress-free as possible. The best way to get in shape is by consuming a healthy diet and performing consistent exercise. While diet is by far the most important factor when it comes to losing weight, participating in a workout program is a close second. If you combine a healthy eating program with this 4-week exercise plan for absolute beginners, you’ll achieve your fitness goals even faster as a result! Get Your Diet in Check Download your free exercise calendar below and never miss a workout! But, before you jump into the program, you need to get your diet in check. To help you get there, we’ve rounded up some of our favorite healthy-eating plans: 14-Day Clean Eating Meal Plan 28-Day Weight Watchers Meal Plan 14-Day Low-Carb Meal Plan 10-Day Complete High-Protein Meal Plan You may also find these Top 10 Weight Loss Tips for Women extremely helpful. Check them out and then let’s get started, shall we? The 4-Week Exercise Plan for Absolute Beginners What you need: a towel or yoga mat / an interval timer (free apps are available for download) / a bench, chair, box, or step / one light set of dumbbells (3 to 8 pounds) / one medium set of dumbbells (10 to 15 pounds) / an open space or a treadmill / a jump rope / and an exercise ball What to do: Perform the designated workout for each day. Follow the instructions for each individual routine according to your fitness level. Each workout includes instructional videos to ensure that you use proper form. items.title: 3 Moves to Tight and Toned Thighs
items.content_excerpt: Home » Fitness » 3 Moves to Tight and Toned Thighs Fitness 3 Moves to Tight and Toned Thighs by Erin Miller Pin Facebook Email Shares 464 Published: April 26, 2019 Last Updated: December 12, 2019 Take a few minutes to tighten and tone your thighs with this fast and fun workout routine! Your body is unique and beautiful just the way it is. Although we are all different shapes and sizes, most of us can agree that there’s always room for improvement! After all, there’s certainly nothing wrong with trying to enhance your appearance and better your health. If your thighs are an area that you’d like to improve, you need to include these three moves to tight and toned thighs in your weekly workout plan. Your thighs are made up of two main muscle groups: the quadriceps in the front and the hamstrings in the back. The exercises below will target these muscles, as well as your abductors (outer thighs), adductors (inner thighs), and your glutes. Remember that consistency is the key to success. Performing this routine 3 to 4 days a week will allow you to see visible results in just 4 to 6 weeks. It’s important to note that any time you’re trying to tighten and tone a muscle group, you must maintain a healthy diet. If you need some guidance, check out these helpful articles: 50 Foods to Help You Lose Weight 7-Day Healthy-Living Plan for Beginners Top 10 Weight Loss Tips for Women 7 Foods that will Help You Tone and Build Muscle Healthy Eating Tips: How to Start Eating Healthy Today 3 Moves to Tight and Toned Thighs What you need: a yoga mat or towel / a medium set of dumbbells (optional) What to do: Perform 10 to 15 repetitions of each exercise with little to no rest in between. Complete 3 to 5 rounds total. We’ve included instructional videos below to ensure that you’re using proper form. The Exercises Sumo Squat Walking Lunges Glute Bridge with Squeeze Notes : For walking lunges, you should complete 10-15 repetitions per leg . Also, you can increase the level of difficulty by holding the dumbbells during the entirety of the workout. Hold them at chest height during squats, down at your sides during lunges, and on your hip bones during bridges. Instructional Videos Sumo Squat Walking Lunges Glute Bridge with Squeeze These are three of the best moves you can do for tight and toned thighs! This routine may not seem challenging, but it will get you the results you are looking for if you stick with it. On top of this routine, you may also want to try out these great, thigh-toning workouts: 14-Day Toned Legs & Thighs Workout Challenge 30-Minute Booty Blast & Thigh Workout 10-Minute Body Weight Circuit for Butt and Thighs We can’t wait for you to try this thigh-toning routine! Let us know what you think and tell us all about your awesome results! Follow us on Facebook , Pinterest , and Instagram for all of the latest and greatest lower body workouts & challenges!

items.title: 9 Best Fitness Routines to Keep You Motivated

Motivation is one of the most important aspects of a fitness routine. After all, if you lack motivation, your chances of sticking to a plan are, well, not good. For this reason, we’ve compiled a list of the nine best fitness routines to keep you motivated and on the path to success! While exercise is a huge component to achieving your goals in a timely manner, it is just as important that you make sure you’re eating properly. If you’re looking to get in shape, you’ll need to find the right diet for you. We have a wide variety of healthy-eating programs to choose from, including: 14-Day Clean-Eating Meal Plan The 30-Day High Protein, Low Carb Challenge 28-Day Vegetarian Weight Watchers Meal Plan 7-Day Whole30 Meal Plan 30-Day Weight Loss Meal Plan 9 Best Fitness Routines to Keep You Motivated Absolute Beginner’s Fat Loss Plan This beginner’s fat loss plan is simple and straightforward. It’s the perfect choice for those of you that are new to the fitness world. The sooner that you realize that losing weight does not have to be complicated, the better off you will be! This plan is full of helpful, healthy-living tips and the best workout routines for beginners! 21-Day Lean and Fit Workout Challenge This 3-week challenge can be performed by anyone regardless of your fitness level. Switching up your routine is good for the body and the soul. There is no doubt that this exciting challenge will put the pep back in your step and kick-up your motivation! 28-Day Body Weight HIIT Workout Challenge Who doesn’t love a bodyweight routine? This 28-day plan will challenge you by getting progressively harder as each week passes. Luckily, the workouts included in this challenge can be performed from just about anywhere, which means there is no excuse not to do them! Better yet, they will provide you with some seriously noticeable results! Look out girl; you’ve got some compliments coming your way. Lean Body HIIT Workout Challenge While it is crucial that you challenge yourself with each workout, every individual begins at a different fitness level. An exercise that is difficult for one person may be easier for another. With that being said, this HIIT Challenge has a version for beginners and another one for experienced participants! A workout that is too challenging can be discouraging, but this routine will allow you to challenge yourself without overdoing it. 30-Day Full Body Transformation Workout Plan Approaching your goals with a plan will make following through a breeze. items.title: Sweet and Salty Healthy Chocolate Covered Pretzels
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Sweet and Salty Healthy Chocolate Covered Pretzels Recipes Sweet and Salty Healthy Chocolate Covered Pretzels 4.15 from 7 votes by SkinnyMs. Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 12k Published: November 30, 2023 The best of both worlds. Is your sweet tooth begging for attention? Just because you practice healthy eating doesn’t mean treating yourself is out of the question. What better way to enjoy a savory snack than with this Sweet and Salty Healthy Chocolate Covered Pretzels recipe? Each bite delivers a double punch of mouthwatering sweetness and scrumptious saltiness, guaranteed to please even the craziest of cravings. Satisfy Your Sweet a nd Salty Cravings You really can’t go wrong with this classic sweet-meets-salty combo. When the two crave-worthy tastes team up, well, an inexplicable magic happens. Sweet and salty are simply meant to be; each flavor enhances the other. What better recipe to demonstrate the dynamic duo than this Sweet and Salty Healthy Chocolate Covered Pretzels recipe? Mouthwatering chocolaty goodness teams up with salty pretzels to give you the most drool-worthy snack ever. And the best part? Our recipe uses clean ingredients you don’t have to feel guilty about. So when you need your sweet and salty fix, look no further. Three Clean and Easy Ingredients This Skinny Ms. snack calls for just three simple ingredients: chocolate, pretzels, and sea salt. We use dark chocolate chips because they actually carry some surprising health benefits. Research claims that dark chocolate is actually one of the best sources of antioxidants available. This can help fight free radicals, boost the immune system, and defend against disease and cancer. Meanwhile, dark chocolate is a great source of iron, magnesium, and zinc. Who would’ve thought? Don’t feel bad about the occasional chocolate indulgence, especially if it’s dark chocolate! Check out Why You Should Eat Dark Chocolate to learn more and 3 Reasons Why It’s Okay to Love Dark Chocolate ! Related: 10 Chocolate Treats Under 150 Calories Our recipe also uses whole-wheat mini pretzels instead of regular pretzels. Inevitably, pretzels are a carb-rich, starchy snack. However, going for the whole-wheat alternative sneaks in more fiber and B vitamins, ultimately making the recipe more nutritious. How To Make Healthy Chocolate Covered Pretzels! Whipping these babies up is an absolute cinch. This clean-eating snack only requires a few painless steps. Simply follow the instructions to melt the chocolate in a double boiler or microwave. After it has reached a silky smooth consistency, drop your pretzels in the chocolate one handful at a time. Next, remove them one by one using a kitchen tong or fork and place them on wax paper. Finally, finish these chocolate goodies with a sprinkle of sea salt. Allow them to harden in the fridge for at least an hour, and voila! Your irresistible, clean-eating, sweet, and salty healthy chocolate covered pretzels are ready for munchin’! With on

items.title: Honey Pepper Chicken
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Meal Type » Dinner » Honey Pepper Chicken Dinner Honey Pepper Chicken 4 from 7 votes by SkinnyMs. Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Share 1.8k Published: November 30, 2023 Bold and tangy in bite-size pieces. Mmm- bite into one of these chewy, juicy delights and prepare to take your taste buds on the ride of their lives. Made with 100% clean and wholesome ingredients, this healthy honey pepper chicken recipe spices up any ordinary chicken dish by delivering bold, tangy flavors in bite-sized pieces. The brilliant combination of black pepper, honey, and soy sauce creates a mouthwatering glaze without the processed sugars and artificial ingredients in store-bought glazes or barbecue sauces. Did we mention the recipe is a snap to whip up? Simply whisk together all ingredients besides chicken, pour the marinade over the chicken pieces, and you’re ready to cook! All the juices come together to give this easy weeknight honey pepper chicken dish a lip-smacking kick. It also makes the perfect, guilt-free tailgating snack and a crown-pleasing party appetizer! And the benefits don’t stop at taste alone. This healthy honey pepper chicken recipe is a nutritional powerhouse. The chicken provides energizing protein while black pepper, ginger, and honey are known for their anti-inflammatory properties and help aid in digestion. Whether you’re hosting a gathering or simply seeking a flavorful twist on a classic, this honey pepper chicken recipe delivers. Honey Pepper Chicken Recipe This dish is easy to make and has the perfect balance of sweet and spicy flavors. The honey adds a hint of sweetness while the pepper provides the heat. The chicken is tender and juicy, and the flavors come together to create a delicious dish. 4 from 7 votes Honey Pepper Chicken This scrumptious honey pepper chicken dish is better than takeout! It’s made with clean and delicious ingredients that are bold, tangy, and nutritious. Review Recipe PIN RECIPE Print Recipe Prep Time 35 minutes minutes Cook Time 10 minutes minutes Total Time 45 minutes minutes Yield 4 people Serving Size Course Dinner Cuisine American Author SkinnyMs. Review Recipe PIN RECIPE Print Recipe Ingredients US Customary – Metric 1 pound boneless and skinless chicken breasts or thighs, cut into large, bite-sized pieces 1/4 cup lite soy sauce low-sodium, (optional tamari) 2 tablespoons honey 2 teaspoons black pepper (more if desired) 1 1/2 tablespoons olive oil 2 teaspoons ginger powder (optional 1 tablespoon peeled and minced ginger root) Instructions Whisk together all of the ingredients for the marinade besides the chicken. Place the chicken pieces in a sealable bag or container and pour the marinade over them. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. Empty the chicken and all of the marinade into a pan over medium heat and cook it for about 10 to 15 minutes, until the chicken pieces are cooked through, stirring frequently. Serve chicken and all of the sauce. Enjoy! Nutrition Information Calories: 228 kcal | Carbo

items.title: Slow Cooker Sweet & Savory Sweet Potatoes
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Method » Slow Cooker » Slow Cooker Sweet & Savory Sweet Potatoes Slow Cooker Slow Cooker Sweet & Savory Sweet Potatoes 4.78 from 18 votes by Gale Compton Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 3.7k Published: November 30, 2023 Last Updated: December 6, 2024 Dish up this mouthwatering crowd-pleaser at your next holiday gathering! We know that holiday meal planning can be stressful. Not only are you looking for ways to entertain and create plenty of delicious foods for large groups of people, but you also want to keep things as healthy as possible. This means canned and boxed foods are not an option, even if they are faster and more convenient. When looking for healthy holiday meals, we like to let fresh, seasonal flavors shine. That’s why we love slow cooker sweet potato recipes—they’re simple, flavorful, and very cozy for the holidays. This recipe is made with both sweet and savory flavors making it an all-time holiday recipe favorite. How to Keep Slow Cooker Sweet Potato Recipes Healthy Want to know how to keep your slow cooker sweet potato recipes healthy and simple? This slow cooker recipe for healthy, savory sweet potatoes is a great way to provide a tasty dish without a lot of effort or added calories. Slow cooker foods can make your holiday meal planning a breeze! The secret to keeping slow cooker sweet potato recipes healthy is to let the natural sweetness of the potatoes shine. There’s no need to add excessive amounts of corn syrup or brown sugar—a little sprinkle of coconut palm sugar and some spices will help bring out the sweet potatoes’ natural sweetness and enhance their subtle, cozy flavors without masking them. Sweet & Savory Slow Cooker Sweet Potato Recipe 4.78 from 18 votes Slow Cooker Sweet & Savory Sweet Potatoes This sweet and savory sweet potato recipe is the healthy version of a holiday favorite. Review Recipe PIN RECIPE Print Recipe Prep Time 15 minutes minutes Cook Time 3 hours hours Total Time 3 hours hours 15 minutes minutes Yield 4 people Serving Size 0.67 cup Course Side Dish Cuisine American Author Gale Compton Review Recipe PIN RECIPE Print Recipe Ingredients US Customary – Metric 1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil (or optional butter) 2 sweet potatoes large, peeled or scrubbed well with the peel on (if organic) and diced into 1-inch cubes 2 cloves garlic minced 1/4 cup coconut sugar optional brown sugar 1/8 teaspoon red pepper flakes 1/2 teaspoon curry powder 1/4 teaspoon black pepper 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon Instructions Add extra-virgin olive oil to the slow cooker and preheat to high while preparing potatoes and garlic. Add potatoes and all remaining ingredients to the slow cooker and toss to combine. Cover and cook on high for 2-3 hours or low for 4-5 hours. We recommend using a 4-6 quart slow cooker. Garnish with chopped parsley, if desired. Nutrition Information Serving: 0.67 cup | Calories: 234 kcal | Carbohydrates: 28 g | Protein: 1 g | Fat: 14 g | Saturated Fat: 2 g | Cholesterol: 21 mg | Sodium

items.title: What is Upside Down Pizza?
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » What is Upside Down Pizza? Recipes What is Upside Down Pizza? 4.34 from 3 votes by Gale Compton Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Share 1.6k Published: November 30, 2023 A guaranteed party-pleaser, this recipe ranks high in our books! What is upside down pizza? Well, if you’re a big fan of pizza, you’ll go wild over this version of the popular comfort food. Unlike traditional pizza, where the crust is layered with tomato sauce and topped with a coat of melty cheese, our upside down pizza pie does a flip! That’s right: instead of a bread crust on the bottom making the foundation for sauce and toppings, a buttery, cheesy crust rests comfortably on top, somewhat like a pot pie. This upside down pizza pie recipe calls for a bunch of mouthwatering, pizza-themed ingredients like tomato paste, mozzarella cheese, garlic, and onion. Ground turkey packs a low-fat protein punch and makes this meal even more substantial and filling. Note that because we make it in a pie pan, this is more of a deep-dish style pizza than the extra thin-crust version you might be used to. But don’t knock it before you try it; the flavors will more than make up for the lack of a bread-based crust, we promise! So what is upside down pizza? A guaranteed party-pleaser, that’s what! Quick Cook and Assembly As you’ll see from reading through the ingredients and cooking steps, this is a pizza that will come together quickly. Whether you use turkey as specified in the recipe or choose to go with another protein like sausage, you need to cook these ingredients first. Same with the onion and garlic. Once they are cooked, you’ll drain them and mix them with your other aromatics, like the tomato paste. The crust ingredients get put together separately. Your “filling” will go into a pie pan, then you’ll pour your “crust” batter on top of the filling. As the pie bakes, the crust will puff a bit and get golden brown. If you’re worried the top will get too brown, you can cover it with a piece of aluminum foil while the pie finishes baking. A warning: similar to the pot pie example we gave earlier when this pie comes out of the oven, you’ll want to let it cool a bit before serving. Those ingredients are molten hot under their cover, so don’t ruin the flavor experience by scorching your tastebuds on the first bite! Variety IS the Spice of Life Don’t feel limited to the ingredients listed, either. You can easily put your own spin on it by adding your favorite ingredients to this pizza mixture. Some suggested “under-ings” (can we call them “toppings” if they are under the crust?) are: Italian sausage (in addition to, or instead of, the turkey as you prefer) Sliced Kalamata olives Sautéed mushrooms (cook first, so the pizza doesn’t become watery) Sun-dried tomatoes (drain well if using the oil-packed variety) Julienned pepperoni slices– a little goes a long way toward adding flavor without adding too much fat Diced and cooked green bell pepper bits Literally, anything you can imagi

items.title: Clean Eating Loaded Healthy Chicken Nachos
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Clean Eating Loaded Healthy Chicken Nachos Recipes Clean Eating Loaded Healthy Chicken Nachos 4.25 from 8 votes by Chef Nichole Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 4.6k Published: November 29, 2023 They're so delicious, you'd never guess they're clean eating! I have a confession to make: I’m totally a nacho addict. They’re just so quick and easy to throw together. That ooey, gooey melted cheese keeps me coming back time and time again. The only problem with this addiction? Well, nachos aren’t exactly known for being super healthy. That only made me more determined to find a clean eating version of my favorite meal, and I finally found it with this recipe for healthy chicken nachos! There’s nothing to hate about these. I love that they’re loaded up with heart-healthy black beans and all kinds of nutrient-dense vegetables like corn, diced tomatoes, and shredded romaine. By using fat-free cheese, I cut out a significant amount of calories in this meal. But I still get the benefit of that oh-so-satisfying melted cheese. So what makes these healthy chicken nachos qualify for a clean eating award? Let’s dive in and take a look! Stone Ground Corn Tortilla Chips This is a really important component of this recipe. Look for a tortilla chip brand that is labeled non-GMO and uses stone-ground corn in the ingredients list. What’s the deal with stone-ground corn? Let me fill you in! Regular cornmeal is made by grinding corn in a mechanical press. This transforms the dried corn into very tiny flour particles, but it has one major drawback: it removes the germ and hull. Stone-ground corn, on the other hand, uses two slowly moving stones to process the dried corn. This does create a coarser grind than the metal grinder, but it preserves the nutrients in the corn. This stone-ground corn not only has more flavor than the regular kind, but it’s also filled with more vitamins, minerals, and fiber . Get ready for a boost of vitamins like thiamine to boost immune activity and vitamin B-6 for healthy brain development. It doesn’t really matter if you choose yellow or white corn chips; they’re both filled with nutrients. It is important to note that yellow corn does have more cancer-fighting carotenoids than its white counterpart. So, if you’re looking to increase your antioxidant intake, perhaps you should opt for yellow corn. Charred Corn + All The Veggies Here’s the second most important part of this recipe: giving the corn a little bit of a char. It took me a long time to realize that char, browning, and caramelization were actually kind of like secret ingredients. They add an extra layer of flavor to your cooking, and getting a little color on the corn will totally transform it from simply sweet to super sweet! Combine that with the raw vegetable toppings of crispy romaine, savory tomatoes, spicy jalapenos, and smooth avocado, and you have a winner. And, if you’re trying to get your nutrition by eating the rainbow, this is totally the way to d

items.title: Slow Cooker Greek Lemon Chicken
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Slow Cooker Greek Lemon Chicken Recipes Slow Cooker Greek Lemon Chicken 4.46 from 59 votes by Gale Compton Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 30k Published: November 29, 2023 Last Updated: March 6, 2025 This dish is perfect for lunch or dinner. It’s impossible to have too many slow cooker chicken recipes on hand! Boneless, skinless chicken breasts are one of our favorite lean proteins because they’re very low in saturated fat. Chicken is also relatively inexpensive at the grocery store, especially if you buy it in bulk—and chicken breasts are so versatile, too! You can use them to make everything from Mexican-spiced enchiladas to this Slow Cooker Greek Lemon Chicken. Wonderful Flavor and Super Healthy! This dish gets its flavor from freshly squeezed lemons. We’ll talk about why buying whole lemons is important in a minute, but first, we want to celebrate how healthy each serving of this dish is. It’s not only low in calories and fits nicely on our list of dinners under 300 calories , but it’s also low-carb and high-protein. A measly 5 grams of carbohydrates is balanced by a whopping 40 grams of protein. How great is that? The Importance of Buying Whole Lemons I have a bottle of lemon juice in my refrigerator, which is convenient when I only need a tablespoon of juice for a recipe. If you can, we’d recommend skipping the bottle for this recipe, though. We call for a whole 1/4 cup of lemon juice, which is quite a bit! Using freshly squeezed lemons will guarantee the brightest, most flavorful sauce for the Slow Cooker Greek Lemon Chicken. Not only that, but you’ll want to use the zest of the lemon, too. While lemon juice is sour and acidic, the rind can be bitter. But, if you only use the outside of the rind and skip the pith (the white layer that separates the rind from the flesh), you’ll be left with a bright, citrusy flavor. It also adds essential oils to your sauce. By combining both the zest and the juice, you’ll create an explosion of lemon-forward flavor. So, how many lemons do you need to buy for this recipe? As a general rule of thumb, each lemon should produce anywhere from 2 to 3 tablespoons of lemon juice. Each one of those lemons will create a tablespoon of zest, too. If your fruits are super juicy, you won’t quite need two full lemons, but it’s good to have them on hand, just in case. You can freeze the leftover juice in ice cube trays to use for later or use them to make our Lemon Ginger Detox Drink . Serving Slow Cooker Greek Lemon Chicken This recipe is perfect for a quick-and-easy dinner, and the leftovers make a fantastic lunch, too. Don’t be afraid to make a large batch of this recipe on the weekend and use the chicken all week long. You can serve it up over a green leaf salad to keep things low-carb. Or, if you have some room in your diet for complex carbohydrates, whip up a batch of fluffy quinoa or brown rice. We’ve even used this Slow Cooker Greek Lemon Chicken recipe as a topping for whole-wheat pasta

items.title: Juicy Fake Fried Chicken
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Juicy Fake Fried Chicken Recipes Juicy Fake Fried Chicken No ratings yet by SkinnyMs. Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Share 1.8k Published: November 29, 2023 A crave-worthy Southern classic- minus the guilt! It’s a Southern classic. With that juicy, savory goodness, it’s the much-craved entreé called deep-fried chicken . The only problem is that most fried chicken recipes are loaded with unhealthy fats, calories, and a plethora of other things that can be extremely harmful to your waistline. For this very reason, we’ve created a Juicy Fake Fried Chicken recipe, so now you can have your “fried” chicken and eat it too! Classic Fried Chicken Flavors and Textures You Love This fake fried chicken is healthier than most fried chicken recipes because, well, it isn’t fried at all. Judging by its incredible flavors and textures, though, you’d never know the difference! Traditional recipes provide us with delectably juicy, perfectly seasoned chicken. That said, the fried option is also beloved for its classic, crispy coating. The combination of tender meat and crunchy breading makes this Southern recipe an American favorite. But wait. This chicken isn’t fried, so how do we get that classic crispy coating? Our low-calorie fake fried chicken is coated in a batter that is made with nonfat buttermilk, dijon mustard, garlic, and hot sauce. We then toss the chicken in flour that has been seasoned with paprika, thyme, salt, pepper, and baking powder, before laying the pieces on a baking sheet and brushing them with heart-healthy olive oil. All that’s left to do is place the chicken in the 425-degree oven and let it bake until it’s got a beautiful, crunchy, golden brown color. A Healthy Alternative to Traditional Recipes On average, one traditionally fried chicken breast comes in at 500 calories. A single serving contains about 28 carbs, 175 mg of cholesterol, and 720 mg of sodium. Additionally, one fried bone-in breast holds 18 grams of fat, 7 of which are saturated. For those of you who aren’t aware, saturated fat is the kind that we want to limit. On the other hand, one serving of our baked chicken is only 262 calories, basically half that of a fried chicken breast. Our recipe only contains 10 carbs, 5 grams of fat, 1 gram of saturated fat, 121 mg of cholesterol, and 358 mg of sodium. As you can see, ours is significantly healthier than the fried option! With this tasty and nutritious recipe in your back pocket, you’ll never need to go back to high-calorie fried chicken ever again! The Perfect Side Dishes for this Juicy “Fried” Chicken So we have a much healthier main course, but what about sides? When you think about what side dishes to serve with your “fried” chicken, chances are good that your mind automatically goes to more not-so-nutritious options. We’re talking about foods like mac & cheese, mashed potatoes, biscuits, and more! Our goal here at SkinnyMs. is to provide you with alternative options for your favorite foods that are not on

items.title: One-Pot Mexican Style Quinoa
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Diet Type » Plant-Based » One-Pot Mexican Style Quinoa Plant-Based One-Pot Mexican Style Quinoa 4.10 from 21 votes by SkinnyMs. Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 27k Published: November 29, 2023 Substitute this healthy quinoa for rice in any Mexican dish! In the mood for Mexican but looking to avoid the heavy feel of takeout fare? Make an easy Mexican meal at home! This Mexican style quinoa dish can be used as a substitute for rice in burritos, tacos, flautas, or as a side. Quinoa is a nutrition powerhouse with its high fiber and protein count. And additional ingredients such as peppers, garlic, cumin, and chili powder add spicy flavor and health benefits. One-Pot Mexican Style Quinoa Quinoa is a gluten-free, plant-based protein that is a great source of vitamins and minerals. It’s perfect for vegetarians, vegans, and anyone looking to add more plant-based protein to their diet. Mexican style quinoa is a delicious and nutritious dish that combines quinoa with Mexican flavors, such as chili powder, cumin, garlic, jalapenos, and cilantro. It’s a great way to add a kick of flavor to quinoa and make a complete meal. Check out our recipe below! 4.10 from 21 votes One-Pot Mexican Style Quinoa This quinoa dish is bursting with Mexican flavors that come from ingredients that are healthy and delicious. Review Recipe PIN RECIPE Print Recipe Prep Time 5 minutes minutes Cook Time 30 minutes minutes Total Time 35 minutes minutes Yield 6 people Serving Size 0.75 cup Course Dinner, Lunch Cuisine Tex-Mex Author SkinnyMs. Review Recipe PIN RECIPE Print Recipe Ingredients US Customary – Metric 1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil 1/2 cup sweet onion or yellow onion, diced 2 garlic cloves minced 1 cup quinoa dry, rinsed well 14 1/2 ounces diced tomatoes can ( BPA-free brand Muir Glen ) 4 ounces diced green chilies can 1 1/2 cups vegetable broth low-sodium 1/4 teaspoon black pepper 1/2 teaspoon kosher or sea salt more or less to taste 1/2 teaspoon cumin 1 teaspoon chili powder 1/2 cup cilantro freshly chopped, for garnish Instructions In a large skillet, add oil and sauté onion until tender, about 4 minutes. Add garlic and continue to sauté for 1 minute. Add the remaining ingredients, except cilantro, and stir to combine. Cover and bring to a boil. Cook until liquid is absorbed and quinoa is tender, approximately 15 minutes. Turn the burner off and allow the covered skillet to set until any remaining liquid is absorbed, 5-10 minutes. Fluff with a fork, add cilantro for garnish, and serve. Notes Tip: Mexican Style Quinoa is delicious served as a side or added to burritos, enchiladas, or tacos. Nutrition Information Serving: 0.75 cup | Calories: 189 kcal | Carbohydrates: 30 g | Protein: 6 g | Fat: 5 g | Saturated Fat: 1 g | Cholesterol: 1 mg | Sodium: 223 mg | Fiber: 5 g | Sugar: 4 g | SmartPoints (Freestyle): 6 | SmartPoints (Freestyle): 6 Keywords Kid-Friendly, Vegetarian Have you made this recipe? items.title: Loaded Cauliflower Bake Healthy Dinner Recipe
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Loaded Cauliflower Bake Healthy Dinner Recipe Recipes Loaded Cauliflower Bake Healthy Dinner Recipe 4.55 from 11 votes by SkinnyMs. Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 2.7k Published: November 29, 2023 Everyone loves a cheesy side that happens to be healthy and delicious! If I could eat a loaded baked potato every day, I totally would. There’s something so fulfilling about a fluffy potato stuffed with cheese and bacon (and it probably doesn’t hurt that it’s topped with even more cheese). While a lot of the ingredients I use to stuff loaded potatoes are Keto-friendly, the potatoes themselves definitely aren’t. They might be a vegetable, but boy, do they ever contain a lot of carbohydrates! So, I turn to my trusty swap-in when it comes to creating healthier versions of my favorite comfort classics: cauliflower. This loaded cauliflower bake healthy dinner recipe will definitely satisfy your cravings for comfort food without packing on the calories. In addition to being low in carbohydrates, cauliflower is just all-around good for you. It’s full of antioxidants to help fight off cancer-causing free radicals, it has a ton of vitamin C and K, and it’s chock-full of fiber to keep you feeling full for hours. Using cauliflower in this recipe isn’t just about amping up the nutrition or tasting great, either. The best thing about this recipe is that it only takes 30 minutes to pull it all together, and the prep is super simple. That’s awesome for busy weeknights when it seems impossible to put a healthy dinner on the table. One Dish, Two Different Results I love creating recipes that can easily be turned into two different meals. This Loaded Cauliflower Bake Healthy Dinner Recipe is no different! You can make this recipe one of two ways. The recipe below tells you how to do it the first way (which happens to be the easier way). But I’ll also explain how you can take this recipe and turn it into your new favorite mashed cauliflower dish. Our recipe steps below tell you how to do it the easiest way. You’ll cut the cauliflower into small florets and bake them until they’re tender-crisp before loading ’em up with the toppings. This doesn’t exactly give you the illusion of potatoes because the florets will hold their shape and form. But you’ll get a ton of chewy texture and delicious flavor! Because this method also happens to be a one-pot meal , it makes cleanup that much easier. Since I’m all about a quick-and-easy meal, this method is my recommendation for weeknight dinners. How To Turn This Dish Into Loaded Mashed Cauliflower For those of you who are really, really craving some mashed potatoes, there’s a second option. But I’ll warn you: It requires the use of extra pots and pans, so cleanup will take longer. Instead of following the first few steps of the recipe, steam your cauliflower florets first. You can do this in the microwave by adding a few tablespoons of water to a microwave-safe bowl. Nuke it for 5-8 minutes, depending on you

items.title: High Protein Overnight Oats
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Meal Type » Breakfast » High Protein Overnight Oats Breakfast High Protein Overnight Oats 5 from 3 votes by Kelsey Butler, MS, RDN Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 346 Published: November 29, 2023 Make your mornings GREAT with this scrumptious, healthy breakfast. Need an easy, high-protein breakfast that will be ready as soon as you get up? Try our high protein overnight oats for weight loss! Full of healthy, filling ingredients, these overnight oats are perfect to give you the energy boost you need to get through the day while keeping you on track to crush your goals. Not only that, but these oats are ready in 2 simple steps– perfect for busy mornings when you need to rush out the door! The Best Overnight Oats Overnight oats are one of my favorite go-to breakfasts for busy weekdays or when I just really don’t feel like cooking. All you need to do is mix the ingredients up the night before, pop them in the fridge, and they’re good to go in the morning! We also threw some yummy toppings in, like sliced banana, chopped peanuts, and mini chocolate chips, just before serving for some added texture and flavor. You can mix up your toppings, though, by swapping in different fruits, nuts, or anything else you may desire! Benefits of Eating Protein-Rich Foods This high protein overnight oats for weight loss recipe is the perfect meal for anyone looking to get more protein in their diet. Protein is important for things like meal satiety, muscle building, and proper cell function. Many high-protein foods also include essential nutrients like iron, calcium, and B vitamins. Eating a high protein diet is said to decrease hunger, increase feelings of fullness, boost metabolic rate, and protect muscle—all aiding in weight loss. High Protein Ingredients This recipe is packed with high-protein ingredients. Things like Greek yogurt, peanuts, and protein powder are especially known for their high protein content. Oats, chia seeds, and skim milk also offer some protein to help boost this recipe to the next level. Not only do these ingredients give you a lot of healthy benefits, but the chocolate and peanutty flavors blend perfectly to please your taste buds, as well. Make These Oats the Night Before! Enjoy these overnight oats with just 2 simple steps! To make this high protein recipe, start by combining the rolled oats, skim milk, Greek yogurt, chocolate protein powder, chia seeds, and peanut butter into a container at night. Mix well, then place in the refrigerator. In the morning (or about 8 hours later), top with sliced banana, chopped peanuts, and mini chocolate chips. Stir it up, and enjoy! Feel free to make a few batches at once for healthy breakfasts all week long! Want another high-protein breakfast idea? Try out our delicious 4-Ingredient Protein Pancakes next! You can also follow this 10-Day Complete High Protein Low Carb Meal Plan for 10 whole days of yummy high-protein meals! High Protein Overnight Oats for Weight Loss 5 from 3 v

items.title: Low-Carb Mug Cakes
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Low-Carb Mug Cakes Recipes Low-Carb Mug Cakes 5 from 1 vote by Kelsey Butler, MS, RDN Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 409 Published: November 29, 2023 Crush cravings with this delectable, 5-minute dessert. Enjoy this single-serving, low-carb mug cake to satisfy your sweet tooth and stay on track to your health goals! This delicious little cake can be made with different add-ins, so feel free to mix and match to make the perfect, custom treat in minutes. Made with mostly classic kitchen staples, try this recipe today for a personalized dessert! The entire family can get in on the mug cake fun! Low-Carb Mug Cakes: Single Serving Sweets I love when I can quickly put together simple ingredients to create a warm and tasty treat just for myself. Many find it easier to stick to their goals with a quick, single-serving dessert because it removes the temptation to overeat. It also means your dessert will always be fresh, warm, and moist when you’re ready for it. And then there’s the added bonus of no food waste! We could go on and on. Low-Carb Desserts This dessert has been given a low-carb stamp of approval thanks to ingredient swaps like almond flour (instead of regular wheat flour) and stevia for sugar. Choosing low-carb desserts can be useful for those with diabetes or people following keto or low-carb diets. Having some sweeter options can be hard to come by if you are trying to keep your carbs down. That said, each of our low-carb mug cakes contains only 6 grams of carbohydrates, making this dessert great for low-carb diets (and even keto-approved if you plan ahead!) Customize Your Low-Carb Mug Cakes Try to mix and match some of these delicious add-ins to personalize your mug cake to your liking! These are only some options. Feel free to get creative! And be sure to let us know what add-ins you chose in the comment section below! Nut Butter Add nut butter for creamy textures and nutty flavors. You can use any nut butter, such as peanut, almond, or even sun butter, if you have allergies! We suggest swirling about one-half to one full tablespoon of nut butter into the batter before cooking and then drizzling one to two teaspoons on top after cooking for extra creamy goodness! Cocoa Powder For an easy chocolate mug cake, mix two teaspoons of cocoa powder into the batter before cooking. Then, you’re ready to go! You can also add some chocolate chips (more below) for even more chocolatey flavors. Chocolate Chip You can add chocolate chips as is or add them with nut butter or cocoa powder for a delicious mixture of flavors. We suggest going for sugar-free chocolate chips to keep the carb count of this recipe low. Sprinkles Mix in some rainbow sprinkles for a celebratory birthday cake look. Personally, I love putting sprinkles on most of my sweets because it makes my desserts look so pretty and fun to eat! You can even top this birthday mug cake with a dollop of whipped cream (or vanilla ice cream) to finish off the look. Create t

items.title: Baked Apple Chips
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Baked Apple Chips Recipes Baked Apple Chips 5 from 3 votes by SkinnyMs. Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 23k Published: November 29, 2023 Who needs potato chips when you have this nutritious, satisfying, and delicious snack?! Ah, apples: This gorgeous fruit is not only healthy, but it also contains so much versatility. Apple stars in countless recipes, from pies and tortes to savory pork roasts and butters. They just have so much to bring to the table! There are so many possibilities to incorporate these juicy delights., This snack recipe for Baked Apple Chips definitely tops our list, but are baked apple chips healthy?. These thinly sliced apple chips are crunchy, lightly sweet, and beyond addictive, creating the perfect solution when hunger strikes. A Guilt-Free Superfood Snack This tasty Baked Apple Chips recipe keeps things simple. It contains two simple ingredients — cinnamon and apples — so they cut to the chase and maintain the apple’s integrity. Cinnamon complements the apples beautifully, adding a warm, comforting flavor to every bite. As a bonus, these delectably sweet snacks create a guilt-free answer to your snack cravings. They’re healthier than most snacks, serving as a brilliant alternative to conventional chips! So when you’re asking yourself, “are baked apple chips healthy?” you can firmly answer yes! This Snack Puts Potato Chips to Shame Unlike traditional chips, our apple chips are baked instead of fried, and they contain absolutely no oil or added fat. These lovely treats get their pleasantly crisp and crunchy character from the oven. Baking apple chips cooks them slowly and evenly, allowing them to maintain their delicious flavor and nutrition. Compared to store-bought chips, our yummy baked apple chips boast a low-calorie, low-carb profile that also contains filling fiber. They make a wonderful weight-loss snack if you’re watching the scale, so there’s no confusion to the question of “are baked apple chips healthy”! Related: 29 Weight Loss Snacks How to Make Baked Apple Chips These crunchy snacks couldn’t be easier to whip up! With just ten minutes of prep, our recipe is quick to throw together, and you’ll have the chips baking in the oven in no time. Two apples create enough chips for six people. Of course, if you want to keep extra on hand for when hunger strikes, simply double the recipe! First, core and thinly slice your apples. Place the sliced apples on a cookie sheet, sprinkle with cinnamon, and bake them at 275 degrees Fahrenheit for an hour. Flip the apple slices over so they cook evenly, and bake them for another hour until they appear nice and crispy. Remove the apple chips from the oven and allow them to cool. What Kind of Apples Should You Use? When it comes to choosing apples, any kind will do depending on your preference. I find that sweet, crisp varieties like Honeycrisp apples, Pink Lady apples, Gala apples, and Fuji apples work wonderfully. Also, for flavor variety and excitement, t

items.title: One-Skillet Chicken and Broccoli Dinner
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Meal Type » Dinner » One-Skillet Chicken and Broccoli Dinner Dinner One-Skillet Chicken and Broccoli Dinner 4.51 from 91 votes by Gale Compton Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 75k Published: January 20, 2026 A quick and healthy meal, made with simple ingredients—perfect for busy weeknights. Hey y’all—Gale here. You know those nights when you’re running on fumes, your kitchen looks like a hot mess, and dinner still has to magically appear on the table? That’s exactly when I reach for this one skillet chicken and broccoli dinner. It’s the ultimate easy weeknight dinner—high protein, low stress, and ready in about 30 minutes. Plus, it’s a one-pan wonder, which means fewer dishes to wash (and I think we can all agree that’s a win). Now, I’ve tested a lot of healthy skillet recipes, but this one is hands-down a keeper. Juicy chicken, crisp-tender broccoli, a little onion and celery for flavor, and a quick homemade teriyaki-style sauce that ties it all together. It’s everything you want in a quick chicken dinner recipe—fast, flavorful, and family-approved. And let’s not forget—this is also a great option if you’re sticking to low-carb chicken meals or just trying to get more simple, balanced recipes into your rotation. Watch How It’s Made Ingredients Needed for this Chicken and Broccoli Dinner Basic ingredients come together to offer a whole bunch of flavor! Here’s what you need: Main Ingredients (the Chicken and Broccoli) 1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil 12 to 18 ounces boneless, skinless chicken breasts (cut into bite-sized pieces) 2 cups broccoli florets 2 garlic cloves, minced 1/2 cup yellow onion, chopped 1/2 cup celery, sliced 1/4 cup chicken broth (or water) 1/4 teaspoon kosher or sea salt 1/4 teaspoon black pepper Sauce Ingredients 1/4 cup coconut aminos (or tamari/low-sodium soy sauce) 2 tablespoons vegetable Sriracha How to Make Our Easy Chicken Dinner This healthy chicken recipe is super simple to make. Follow these easy steps: Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium. Add the chicken and brown on all sides, about 8 minutes. Remove and set aside. Add broccoli florets to the pan and sauté until slightly tender. Remove and set aside with the chicken. Toss in the onion and celery and cook for 5 to 8 minutes, until softened. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds, just until fragrant. Add broth (or water), chicken, and broccoli back into the skillet along with salt and pepper. Cook another 5 minutes, until chicken is heated through. Whisk together the sauce ingredients, pour into the skillet, and cook for one last minute. Done! Reader Q&A: Skillet Dinner Edition Can I use frozen broccoli? Yep! Just thaw and pat it dry first so you don’t end up with extra water in the pan. What should I serve with this? Brown rice, quinoa, or cauliflower rice are all great. You can even wrap leftovers in a whole-grain tortilla for an easy lunch. Can I swap chicken breasts for thighs? Absolutely—just cook a little longer since thighs tak

items.title: Baked Chicken Quesadilla Casserole
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Baked Chicken Quesadilla Casserole Recipes Baked Chicken Quesadilla Casserole 4.91 from 10 votes by Chef Nichole Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 7.9k Published: November 29, 2023 A warm and cheesy chicken casserole. Growing up, “quesadillas” were one of many things my sister and I realized we could “cook” all by ourselves in the microwave. Our recipe was simple: Two tortillas and whatever kind of cheese my mom had in the fridge. We just popped it all in the microwave until it was melted and garnished it with a dollop of sour cream if we were in the mood. We definitely thought we had designed the epitome of classy after-school snacks. Fortunately, our palettes and cooking abilities have both evolved since then. These days, you won’t often find me chowing down on a soggy microwave “quesadillas.” You will, however, find me trying lots of healthy, grown-up recipes that pay homage to one of my earliest attempts in the kitchen. This baked chicken quesadilla casserole is one of my favorite takes yet. Classic chicken quesadillas get a spicy twist with cumin and chili powder. Meanwhile, preparing this dish as a casserole makes for easy prep and a perfect weeknight meal. Mexican Made Easy In many ways, this dish is basically a Mexican lasagna. It packs all of your favorite Mexican flavors into one healthy and delicious baked dish. Whether it’s in quesadillas or tortilla soup, shredded chicken is a star in southwestern recipes. It’s one of my favorite ways to eat chicken, and you’ll find it in this baked chicken quesadilla casserole as well. Along with the fun and flavorful spices mentioned above, this recipe also packs all the other can’t-miss staple ingredients of Mexican cooking. In this cheesy chicken bake, you’ll find tortillas, layered quesadilla style, and tons of corn and black beans for a delicious “fiesta” casserole. Meanwhile, this quesadilla casserole packs plenty of (reduced-fat) cheese and (fat-free) sour cream for a healthy twist on must-have quesadilla ingredients. While this chicken quesadilla casserole may not be quite as easy as popping two tortillas in the microwave, it comes pretty close (and tastes much better). Casseroles are notoriously easy “make ahead” meals. This recipe will only take you about an hour to make. And, of course, we all know casseroles are ideal for leftovers. Pack them for lunch the next day or make this recipe ahead and serve for dinner all week. Enjoy this healthy and delicious take on quesadillas, and prep an easy meal that fortunately doesn’t require the microwave. 4.91 from 10 votes Baked Chicken Quesadilla Casserole This scrumptious Mexican-inspired casserole contains all our favorite ingredients in one amazing bite. items.title: Quick and Easy Roasted Vegetable Skewers
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Meal Type » Snacks » Quick and Easy Roasted Vegetable Skewers Snacks Quick and Easy Roasted Vegetable Skewers 4.32 from 47 votes by Chef Nichole Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 7.3k Published: November 28, 2023 A fun and flavorful way to enjoy roasted vegetable skewers. Getting enough veggies just got a whole lot easier with these quick and easy roasted vegetable skewers. Let’s face it: sometimes food just tastes better when it’s served on a stick. No one really knows why, but it’s true! It’s the reason why lollipops are fun and flirty while hard candies belong on the bottom of your grandma’s purse. And why we invented corn dogs (probably). Take a great food, put it on a stick, and it just gets better. That same inexplicable logic also brought us these roasted vegetable skewers. They’re a quick and easy way give your favorite roasted veggie a fun, simple update that will leave you craving more. A Bold Assortment of Veggies Kebabs are as much about aesthetics as they are about flavor. These roasted vegetable skewers certainly don’t disappoint in either category. Our roasted vegetable skewers boast a wide assortment of colors and flavors, including bell peppers, squash, onion, tomatoes, and mushrooms. To craft the perfect kebab aesthetic, place one piece of green pepper on the stick followed by a piece of yellow squash, onion, tomato, then mushroom. Repeat the pattern until the skewers are full. While these veggies definitely pack a variety of flavors, the kebabs get a boost from a brush of tasty oil . A mix of olive oil, basil, oregano, garlic, and thyme compliments the natural earthy flavors of these roasted vegetables. Perfect For All Seasons: Roasted Vegetable Skewers Kebabs tend to be a go-to summer treat, but you can enjoy this recipe all year round. You don’t need to go outside to make kebabs, either. You can make these quick and easy roasted vegetable skewers right in your oven. Once you’ve prepared the skewers and brushed the veggies with the olive oil mixture, just pop the kebabs into the oven and cook them for 8 minutes. Then, turn the skewers over and return them to the oven for another 5 to 6 minutes. Voila: perfectly roasted kebabs! If you are craving a more summery kebab experience, feel free to toss these skewers on the grill. While you’re out there, whip up one of our favorite summertime grilled fruit desserts . Either way, these quick and easy roasted veggie kebabs are a fun and flavorful way to conjure up some veggie cravings. Enjoy! 4.32 from 47 votes Quick and Easy Roasted Veggie Kebabs You'll fit plenty of veggies into your diet with these perfectly seasoned kebabs. Bring color to your plate and vitamins to your body in this tasty recipe. items.title: Homemade DIY Date Syrup
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Dish Type » Condiments » Homemade DIY Date Syrup Condiments Homemade DIY Date Syrup No ratings yet by Alison Borel Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 98 Published: November 28, 2023 Last Updated: January 31, 2024 This miracle sweetener is the health industry’s newest darling. Homemade DIY Date Syrup is so easy to make, especially if you already have dates in the pantry. It’s the perfect substitute for liquid sweeteners like honey or maple syrup, but date syrup contains a lot more nutrition . In fact, date syrup contains 25% less sugar than honey, which is another reason to keep the honey for the bees. Given the fact that dates are full of magnesium, and potassium, and are high in antioxidants, it’s no wonder this miracle sweetener is the health industry’s newest darling. And the taste? Its natural complexity, and deep sweetness is completely void of bitter aftertaste. How nice it is to have such a sweet option when compared to other sugar alternatives. Liquid Sweetener Super Hero’s Origin Israel has been home to date syrup since before Christ. In fact, the Bible mentions dates as one of the first seven original food species native to the land during biblical times, along with wheat, barley, grapes, olives, figs, and pomegranates. California updated the richness of this fruit by introducing Medjool sapling trees to Israel in the 1970’s. During the 80’s, dates became more popular in the U.S., but it seemed we had a strange relationship with them until now. Boxed cereals tried adding dried dates, but it never took off. Now, dried dates are sold in the produce section as well as the dried fruits section in your local grocery store. How To Make DIY Date Syrup If dates aren’t already a staple in your life, you might want to consider them. As a snack, the energy, vitamins, and minerals they provide are unchartered. Instead of scrounging for sweets like cookies or stale granola bars, try eating dried dates instead to cure your sugar cravings. And if you’ve run out of honey, molasses, maple syrup, or even brown sugar, making homemade date syrup is an easy substitute. To get a half-cup of syrup, all you need is a cup of dates, three cups of water, a small pot, cheesecloth, a potato masher, and a stove. That’s it! After boiling the dates for about twenty minutes, drain them and mash them with a potato masher in the pot used for boiling. Transfer the mixture to a piece of cheesecloth that can fully envelop the dates and squeeze the cloth over the pot. You’re going to want to run a rubber spatula across the underside to grab all that good stuff, too. Then, repeat the process. Add a quarter or so more water to your squeezed date mixture and boil it again just for good measure. Squeeze the pulp one more time into the first batch of virgin syrup, then simmer it for a good 45 minutes until the syrup begins to reduce, thicken, and darken. Just like that, you can say you make your own unrefined sugar! How To Use This Liquid Sweetener As menti

items.content_excerpt: Home » Weight Loss » 21 Healthy Crock-Pot Recipes For Weight Loss Weight Loss 21 Healthy Crock-Pot Recipes For Weight Loss by SkinnyMs. Pin Facebook Email Shares 2.7k Published: November 28, 2023 Just throw the ingredients in the crock-pot and let the healthy and delicious aromas fill your home! Healthy slow cooker recipes for weight loss are such a great option for anyone who has a busy lifestyle and just wants to come home to a clean dinner that will fill them up without adding to their waistline. Healthy Slow Cooker Recipes for Weight Loss If you are tight on time, or have a family to feed, these delicious meals will do the trick! 1. Crockpot Skinny Lemon Chicken Packed with 20 grams of protein and a mere 289 calories per serving, this healthy slow cooker recipe for weight loss will provide you with one guilt-free meal. The addition of lemon not only provides a touch of zest, but helps to keep you feeling full for longer. Get the recipe: Crockpot Skinny Lemon Chicken 2. Slow Cooker Red Lentil Curry This red lentil curry is a soul-warming meal that’s packed with healthy ingredients, including lentils, which are a great source of protein and fiber. The dish is bursting with flavor thanks to the herbs and spices and a great healthy slow cooker recipes for weight loss. Get the recipe: Slow Cooker Red Lentil Curry 3. Crock Pot Baked Sweet Potatoes Sweet potatoes are a wonderful superfood – and super delicious. This recipe features a mere two ingredients, has just 142 calories, and zero fat! Sweet potatoes are the perfect addition to any healthy slow cooker recipes for weight loss Get the recipe: Crock Pot Baked Sweet Potatoes 4. Slow Cooker Beef and Black Bean Stew Love black beans? Good! They’re great for your weight loss goals because they are high in protein and have virtually no fat. This black bean stew is your go-to for a hearty meal that’s full of healthful ingredients, including lean protein. Get the recipe: Slow Cooker Beef and Black Bean Stew 5. Slow Cooker Spinach Artichoke Chicken This slow cooker spinach and artichoke chicken recipe makes for an incredible dinner recipe to add to your healthy slow cooker recipes for weight loss. Along with being high in protein, the dish features garlic and spinach, both of which also aid in weight loss. The garlic, for instance, is rich in allicin, which lowers cholesterol and fats. Get the recipe: Slow Cooker Spinach Artichoke Chicken 6. Slow Cooker Winter Vegetable Medley On those cold nights, try this low-calorie vegetable dish that’s bursting with flavor, as well as a healthy dose of vitamins and minerals. It’ll fill you up without weighing you down. Get the recipe: Slow Cooker Winter Vegetable Medley 7. Veggie Shepherd’s Pie Get your comfort food fix with this veggie shepherd’s pie. The dish is low in calories, has a hefty 48 grams of protein per serving, and is beaming with flavors from the array of nutritious vegetables. Get the recipe: Veggie Shepherd’s Pie 8. items.title: The Best of All Mediterranean Smoothie Recipes
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Cuisine » Mediterranean » The Best of All Mediterranean Smoothie Recipes Mediterranean The Best of All Mediterranean Smoothie Recipes No ratings yet by SkinnyMs. Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 9.4k Published: November 28, 2023 "Beet" the heat with this delicious smoothie! Smoothie fans rejoice! This is the best of all Mediterranean smoothie recipes because it manages to include some of the healthiest, least-used smoothie veggies around and still taste delicious. If you’re not a beet lover, don’t worry, there isn’t enough beet juice in this yummy smoothie to make the taste overpowering. As a matter of fact, there is just a hint of beet taste and only enough to make your taste buds ask, “I wonder what’s in this smoothie? Whatever it is, it tastes yummy”. Mediterranean Smoothie Recipes Healthy smoothies are such a delight. They taste great and are just filling enough to satisfy your hunger. They make great meal replacements, but smaller servings are also appropriate for snacks. Many people love to use them to refuel after an intense workout. The best Mediterranean smoothie recipes incorporate both fruits and veggies but use a balance so the smoothie has a sweet, almost dessert-like taste. Even kids love drinking smoothies! Our site features a wide variety of smoothie recipes. Check out a few of our best here and here . No matter what your taste buds are craving or what your body needs for a boost of energy, there is a smoothie recipe that can help! The Best of All Mediterranean Smoothie Recipes No ratings yet The Best of All Mediterranean Smoothie Recipes This Mediterranean smoothie is filled with healthy yummy goodness, such as beet juice and tropical fruits! Review Recipe PIN RECIPE Print Recipe Prep Time 5 minutes minutes Total Time 5 minutes minutes Yield 2 people Serving Size 0.5 recipe Course Drinks Cuisine Mediterranean Author SkinnyMs. Review Recipe PIN RECIPE Print Recipe Ingredients US Customary – Metric 2 cups baby spinach loosely packed, organic 1 teaspoon ginger root fresh, minced 1 banana frozen, pre-sliced 1 mango small 1/2 cup beet juice (beets originate in the Mediterranean) 1/2 cup skim milk or unsweetened almond milk 6 ice cubes Instructions Toss all the above ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth. Notes You can purchase beets in a can which have beet juice already. I prefer to make my own. Wash fresh beets, pat dry, preheat the oven to 375 degrees, rub the outside of the beets with a little olive oil, wrap them in foil, and roast for 50 – 60 minutes or until tender. Allow the beets to cool at room temperature and peel. Add one beet to a smoothie, and you’ve got one healthy drink! items.title: Simple Bell Pepper Cream Cheese Snack Bites
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Meal Type » Snacks » Simple Bell Pepper Cream Cheese Snack Bites Snacks Simple Bell Pepper Cream Cheese Snack Bites No ratings yet by SkinnyMs. Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 380 Published: November 28, 2023 Last Updated: August 28, 2024 Snack time just got way more exciting! Just because we are eating healthy does not mean we can’t have snacks. In fact, adding a nutritious snack between meals can be very good for you on many levels. It’s important that we have something on hand that is easy and quick to make when that snack attack hits. Our simple bell pepper cream cheese snack bites are sure to become your new go-to! Not all Snacks are Created Equal Snacks, by themselves, are not evil or damaging to a healthy eating plan. It’s what we eat (or how much) that can cause problems. Incorporating small “mini meals” or snacks into our daily eating plan is a great way to keep ahead of out-of-control hunger at mealtimes, but it also has other benefits. Eating a healthy snack can keep blood sugar levels in check and contribute to maintaining our metabolism during the day. And planning ahead to have a nutritious snack on hand keeps us from reaching for a quick-fix bag of chips, cookies, or worse. That’s where our bell pepper cream cheese snack bites come in. Bell peppers have a natural crunch factor that makes them incredibly satisfying to munch on. Plus, they are packed with vitamins such as A and C. Bell peppers are also naturally low-carb, which is great for those of us who are limiting our carb consumption. For our snack bites, we are going to use those cute little “mini peppers” that are sold in a mixed bag at most grocery stores. Pick your favorite color or mix them up as you choose! Now, Add a Filling Now, we need some extra flavor—and a dose of creaminess will make a great contrast to the crunch of the peppers. We start with a whipped cream cheese and season it up with garlic, some snipped chives, parsley, and salt and pepper to taste. The cream cheese (besides being yummy) has another purpose: adding a little fat to a meal goes a long way toward keeping you satiated. It doesn’t have to be much, but that extra little ingredient gives your tummy something to work on after it has digested the veggie base. Assembly is easy. Simply mix up your cream cheese, spoon it into your pepper halves, and top with a few more grinds of fresh pepper and a sprinkle of chives. Pretty, nutritious, crunchy, AND creamy. Take that, snack attack! Convenient and Portable One other benefit of these simple bell pepper cream cheese snackers? You can make them at home ahead of time and keep them refrigerated to eat later in the day. Or, pop some into a portable container and take them with you to the office, a picnic, or even on a road trip. You do want to keep them fresh to maximize the bell pepper crunch, but you can easily see how they can become a new favorite, whether at home or on the go. items.title: Southern Fried Chicken Sliders
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Dish Type » Sandwiches » Southern Fried Chicken Sliders Sandwiches Southern Fried Chicken Sliders No ratings yet by Chef Nichole Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 339 Published: November 27, 2023 Last Updated: December 6, 2024 A guilt-free recipe for crispy baked chicken. These two things probably don’t come to mind when you think of healthy food: Cheesecake Factory and fried chicken. And yet, here we are. This skinny version of the Cheesecake Factory’s Southern Fried Chicken Sliders lets you enjoy Southern comfort food without any of the guilt. Cheesecake Factory Southern Fried Chicken Sliders The Cheesecake Factory Southern Fried Chicken Sliders are a delicious way to enjoy fried chicken. They are served on a mini brioche bun and topped with creamy coleslaw and pickles. They are made with 100% all-natural chicken and are seasoned with a blend of herbs and spices for an unforgettable flavor. You can enjoy these sliders as a snack or as an appetizer before your main meal. However, we’ve got the skinny on an alternative, healthier way of recreating these bad boys at home! Our healthy Cheesecake Factory Southern fried chicken sliders are great because they don’t sacrifice flavor while remaining a healthy dinner! The chicken provides protein, the accompanying veggies provide important micronutrients, and the bun provides carbs. They are the ideal dinner for every occasion due to the blend of flavors and textures. Whether you’re a Cheesecake Factory fanatic, a Southern fried chicken lover, or both, this recipe will put your favorite comfort food back on the table. Thank goodness for skinny copycat recipes! Baked, Not Fried The key to making the Cheesecake Factory Southern Fried Chicken Sliders more health-conscious? Ditch the fried chicken. For this skinny copycat recipe, we’ve swapped out fried chicken for a healthier baked chicken breast. Dipped in buttermilk and coated in a flavorful mix of Panko and spices, this chicken has all the crispy goodness of classic fried chicken without all the fat, calories, and overall heaviness. Once you taste this healthy baked chicken alternative, you may never go for real fried chicken again. Even better: This chicken only needs about 10 minutes in the oven to cook. How much easier is that than making traditional fried chicken at home? No need to worry about heating up all that oil and figuring out how to dispose of it later. This skinny take on Cheesecake Factory’s Southern Fried Chicken Sliders wouldn’t be complete without the perfect combination of toppings. Whole wheat slider buns keep this recipe healthy (and, honestly, they’re tastier and more flavorful than traditional white bread buns, anyway). Place the crispy “fried” chicken on the buns and top it off with crunchy lettuce, sliced tomato, and (of course) a few dill pickle slices. items.title: Scrumptious and Savory Low-Calorie Spinach and Feta Muffins
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Meal Type » Breakfast » Scrumptious and Savory Low-Calorie Spinach and Feta Muffins Breakfast Scrumptious and Savory Low-Calorie Spinach and Feta Muffins 4.58 from 7 votes by SkinnyMs. Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 918 Published: November 27, 2023 Spruce up your lunchbox or picnic basket! Spruce up your lunchbox or picnic basket with these Whole-Wheat Spinach and Feta Savory Muffins! Nourishing and delicious, these baked goods disguise your veggies in layers of tasty goodness. These moist muffins call for nothing but wholesome, clean ingredients like baby spinach, chopped chives, and scrumptious spices. Low-Calorie Spinach and Feta Muffins Whether it’s in preparation to hit the gym or used as an alternative to help stave off the weight gain from sugar-packed muffins, these low-calorie spinach and feta muffins will be sure to hit the spot and the best part is, they’re relatively easy to make! Spinach is rich in fiber and feta cheese is an excellent low-calorie source of vitamins and minerals, with a good amount of sodium (It also contains saturated fats, which should be kept to less than 10% of your daily calorie intake). These low-calorie spinach and feta muffins are a delicious, nutritious snack that will give you the energy you need without weighing you down. Plus, they’re a great way to sneak in some veggies! You can eat them hot and fresh off the tray, or you can pack them up and enjoy them later. You can try to tempt fate by adding a little bit of unsalted butter in the middle for a little extra oomph, but that’s up to you (we won’t judge!). These crowd-pleasers are quick to whip up and make a light, healthy alternative to bread rolls at meals. Bake and enjoy! 4.58 from 7 votes Spinach and Feta Savory Muffins These savory and healthy muffins are perfect as a light snack or side dish. Review Recipe PIN RECIPE Print Recipe Prep Time 15 minutes minutes Cook Time 30 minutes minutes Total Time 45 minutes minutes Yield 12 people Serving Size 1 muffin Course Breakfast, Side Dish, Snack Cuisine Universal Author SkinnyMs. Review Recipe PIN RECIPE Print Recipe Ingredients US Customary – Metric 1 1/2 cups flour we used white whole-wheat flour 2 teaspoons baking powder 1/2 teaspoon baking soda 1/4 teaspoon paprika 1/4 teaspoon sea salt 1/4 teaspoon black pepper 1 cup milk 1% or 2% will work 1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons coconut oil optional pure butter 1 egg large, beaten 1 lemon zested 1 cup baby spinach chopped into small pieces 1 cup feta cheese crumbles low-fat 1 tablespoon chives finely chopped Instructions Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Oil or line with paper cups, a 12-cup muffin tin. Add dry ingredients to a mixing bowl and whisk to combine. Add remaining ingredients and stir just until combined. Ladle into muffin cups until each is 2/3 full. Bake for 30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Enjoy! items.title: 21 Dietetic Desserts for Diabetics
items.content_excerpt: Home » Meal Planning » Recipe Collections » 21 Dietetic Desserts for Diabetics Recipe Collections 21 Dietetic Desserts for Diabetics by Kelsey Butler, MS, RDN Pin Facebook Email Shares 9.6k Published: November 26, 2023 Satisfy your sweet tooth while keeping blood sugar in check! Just because you have diabetes, doesn’t mean you can’t have dessert! It’s okay to indulge in treats from time to time, you just have to choose the right kinds! Selecting a low-carb dessert option is the way to go. This way, you can satisfy your sweet tooth without messing up your blood sugar! We’ve gathered 21 low-carb, low-sugar Skinny Ms. desserts for diabetics that will fulfill all the desires of your tastebuds. Although sweets can affect your blood sugar and a high-sugar diet can raise your risk of developing diabetes, there are many other variables that influence diabetes development, including genetics and lifestyle. You need to closely track your carbohydrate intake if you have high blood sugar levels, prediabetes, or diabetes. This is because carbohydrates cause your blood sugar levels to rise. While you can eat sugary foods if you have diabetes, you should do so in moderation and with some knowledge of how they may affect your blood sugar. Sugars found in desserts and sweets are included. Not to worry though! We’ve got the perfect dietetic desserts for you to feast your eyes (and tastebuds) on! 21 Dietetic Desserts From this list, you’ll find there are so many ways to create delicious desserts without a bunch or carbs and sugar. Give these diabetic-friendly recipes a go to see for yourself! All of the desserts on this list contain a maximum of 15 grams of sugar and carbs per serving ( but most have a lot less )! Quinoa Almond Joy Bars These Quinoa Almond Joy Bars are an awesome dessert to prep and keep on hand. At only 10 grams of carbs per serving, these high fiber bars will surely satisfy your chocolate craving! Get the recipe: Quinoa Almond Joy Bars 3-Ingredient Peanut Butter Cups With only three ingredients, these low-carb peanut butter cups are a quick and easy way to fulfill your nutty sweet treat needs without messing up your blood sugar. They are packed with healthy fats, which is great for glucose regulation, as well! Get the recipe: 3-Ingredient Peanut Butter Cups Skinny Strawberry-Banana Bread Our mini loaves of strawberry banana bread are a treat you just have to try! Even though they definitely pack in the flavor, each serving has only 10 grams of carbs (and 5 grams of sugar!) Chocolate Peanut Butter Popcorn This recipe makes for the perfect game-day dessert and is super easy to make. Using semi-sweet chocolate keeps the sugar content down, and popcorn is a great low carbohydrate grain for diabetics. Get the recipe: Chocolate Peanut Butter Popcorn Bell Pepper Candy Bell pepper for dessert? You’d be surprised that this two-ingredient sweet treat is a delicious crunchy candy that clocks in at 12 calories per serving. Get the recipe: Bell Pepper Candy C

items.title: Philly Cheesesteak Omelette
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Meal Type » Breakfast » Philly Cheesesteak Omelette Breakfast Philly Cheesesteak Omelette 5 from 1 vote by Kelsey Butler, MS, RDN Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 3.6k Published: November 26, 2023 A new, low-carb take on an American classic. Our new, Philly cheesesteak omelette recipe pulls all of the traditional Philadelphia flavors together into a healthy breakfast option. Whether you need a way to use up some leftover steak, or want to prepare a special brunch for your loved ones, this omelette is sure to impress! And while this meal is low in carbs, it’s high in protein and healthy fats that will keep you and your guests full and satisfied for hours! A breakfast omelet cooked with two eggs and some vegetables is a good and quick weight-loss breakfast. We can’t conceive of a better omelet because it has all of the fantastic elements found in a Philly cheesesteak sandwich, as well as incredible edible eggs. This delectable Philly Cheesesteak omelette is savory, creamy, and the perfect all-around breakfast fare without too much guilt. It keeps you full for a long time and energizes you for a busy morning, afternoon, or evening. A Taste of Philly The original Philly Cheesesteak’s unique blend of taste, texture, and juicy flavor is one of its highlights. If diners are not instructed to stoop over their sandwiches to prevent dripping down their arms, they are most likely eating a cheesesteak rather than an authentic Philly Cheesesteak. Philly cheesesteaks are one of Philadelphia’s most famous dishes. Traditionally, these big subs (or hoagies– if you’re from Philly like me) are made with thinly sliced steak, provolone cheese, and a sauteed onion and green bell pepper mix. We’ve folded all of those classic ingredients into a delicious omelette to offer the same great flavor, just for breakfast! Stay Energized with a Big Breakfast You may have heard that it’s important to eat breakfast every day, and as a dietitian, I agree! Not eating in the morning can cause low energy, agitation, and even massive cravings that lead to overeating later on. Instead of skipping breakfast to save calories, try to eat small and nutritious meals and snacks consistently throughout the day, including breakfast! This low-carb, nutrient-dense omelette is a great choice for a high-energy breakfast that can help you avoid extreme hunger later on. Fill Up on this Philly Classic You can whip this savory omelette up in just 20 minutes! Start by heating a medium pan or skillet over medium heat. Add a little bit of olive oil and once hot, toss in your sliced onion and green bell pepper. Saute the veggies for about 5 minutes or until soft, then add cooked steak for just minute to warm it up. Remove the steak and veggies from the pan. Beat the eggs in a mixing bowl and then, pour a quarter of the scrambled eggs into the skillet, letting it cover the whole pan.
