items.title: Marinara Sauce Anyone Can Make
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Marinara Sauce Anyone Can Make Recipes Marinara Sauce Anyone Can Make 5 from 1 vote by Giorgio Pintzas Monzani Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 113 Published: August 9, 2023 Last Updated: September 20, 2024 Once you try homemade sauce, you'll never go back to store-bought! There are so many foods that bring to mind beautiful Italy. Pizza, pasta, meatballs, parmesan cheese, and of course marinara sauce. Think about some of your favorite Italian dishes. Do any of them require this delicious red sauce? Chances are good that they do! And because so many recipes require a rich, flavorful marinara sauce, it’s incredibly important to make sure you use a good one! Our marinara sauce that anyone can make is so simple, yet so delicious. Table of Contents The Importance of Sauces in Italian Cuisine and Beyond Marinara Sauce in Italian Cuisine The Tomato: One of America’s Most Important “Gifts” to Europe Italian Cuisine in America Recipes of Italian-American Cuisine How to Choose the Best Ingredients Let’s Make Some Marinara Sauce How to Make it Higher in Protein How to Serve Marinara Sauce Anyone Can Make How to Store the Spaghetti Sauce Frequently Asked Questions The Importance of Sauces in Italian Cuisine and Beyond Italian food boasts many different sauces and condiments. You can find recipes that are vegetable-based, animal-based, dairy-based, and more! As in every culinary culture, sauces are at the base of the flavor pyramid, made with elements that have been passed down throughout the centuries. Italian cuisine follows simple, homemade guidelines. Sauces consist of minimal ingredients and require just a few steps to create them. They are largely associated with pasta, such as marinara, pesto, alfredo, and more. But in reality, their use goes far beyond that, covering the sphere of appetizer and main course in hundreds of recipes. Marinara Sauce in Italian Cuisine In most of the world-famous and recognized Italian recipes, marinara sauce is the star. Spaghetti and meatballs, eggplant or chicken parmigiana , ziti, lasagna, and even pizza are all dishes that need marinara sauce. In short, used and known by everyone, it has become a real must-have item in the refrigerators of Italian food lovers. In Italy, however, no one talks about marinara sauce. On the Italian peninsula you will practically never hear the word “marinara sauce” to explain today’s recipe. That’s because in our country we simply call it “sugo” (sauce). The only reason you would read “marinara” on a restaurant menu in Italy will be to indicate a pizza (pizza marinara, precisely). How is it made? Simple: tomato sauce and garlic! The Tomato: One of America’s Most Important “Gifts” to Europe Playbills, aprons, and restaurant signs, everything related to “Italian cuisine” always seems to be accompanied by an image of a tomato. However, this does not mean that Mediterranean cuisine immediately embraced it since its first appearance. When the tomato arrived on the coas

items.title: The Best Detox Salad In A Jar
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » The Best Detox Salad In A Jar Recipes The Best Detox Salad In A Jar No ratings yet by Kelsey Butler, MS, RDN Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 80 Published: August 5, 2023 Last Updated: November 20, 2023 This colorful salad offers a diverse array of nutrients. If you’re a fan of mason jar salads , this detoxifying salad recipe is a must-try. Packed with veggies and healthy fats, and drizzled with a simple and delicious dressing, this salad in a jar makes the perfect quick and customizable lunch. Whether you’re meal-prepping for the work week or just looking for an easy way to enjoy your salad at home, this salad has you covered. Not to mention, you’ll truly be eating the rainbow! This colorful salad offers a diverse array of nutrients to keep you satisfied all afternoon. Once you try it, you’ll understand why we call it the best detox salad in a jar! Table of Contents Reasons to Love the Best Detox Salad How to Make This Detoxifying Salad in a Jar Serving Suggestions Storage and Leftovers Ingredients Used Frequently Asked Questions Watch How It’s Made More Healthy Salad Recipes Reasons to Love the Best Detox Salad This super healthy salad is like fireworks on your tongue. It’s light and crunchy with creamy avocado and flavorful feta, plus a hint of tangy sweetness from the pomegranate seeds. A perfectly balanced meal, this jarred salad is loaded with health benefits and designed to detox. Plus, you can easily make swaps, omissions, or additions to fit your preferences. Try adding chickpeas, red cabbage, almonds, radishes, tomatoes, red onions, walnuts, fresh parsley, mint…anything your heart desires. And there’s nothing like a homemade salad dressing! This one is so light and simple but brings out the salad’s flavors so nicely. Ready in ten minutes or less (and so easy to meal prep in batches), this salad will not only save you time but also provide you with the energy boost you need to power through that post-lunch time slump. Plus, it’s super portable and leaves you with minimal dishes–just prep the ingredients, do a little layering, add the dressing, and eat your masterpiece straight out of the jar whenever you’re ready to enjoy it. How to Make This Detoxifying Salad in a Jar This detox salad in a jar couldn’t be easier to make. Below are the details on how to whip it together in three easy steps. The entire process takes less than 10 minutes, so you can make this detox salad in the morning before work. But they’ll be good if made a day or two ahead of time, as well! Make the Dressing Add one tablespoon of extra virgin olive oil, the juice of one lemon, half a teaspoon of salt, and half a teaspoon of black pepper to a small bowl and whisk to combine. Voilà! You’ve got your dressing. Build Your Salad in a Jar Between two mason jars, evenly divide your prepped ingredients–a cup of cooked quinoa, a diced cucumber, a diced bell pepper, half of a diced avocado, half a cup of pomegranate seeds, a fourth cup of shelled pumpkin

items.title: Pork Banh Mi Bowl
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Dish Type » Bowls » Pork Banh Mi Bowl Bowls Pork Banh Mi Bowl No ratings yet by Chef Sallie Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 15 Published: July 27, 2023 Last Updated: December 6, 2024 There's more room to play with flavors and textures! I love a good banh mi sandwich. Perfectly seasoned pork, fresh ginger, pickled vegetables, spicy jalapenos, all on a crusty roll. It’s one of my favorite sandwiches! But I wanted to find a way to enjoy the flavors of this fantastic sandwich without the heaviness of the bread. This is how my pork banh mi bowl came to be! What is Banh Mi? “Banh mi” actually translates to “bread” or “wheat bread” in English but it specifically refers to the type of French-inspired baguette used in the traditional banh mi sandwich. However, “banh mi” is often used to refer to the entire sandwich, not just the bread itself. This is why we’re still able to use the phrase “banh mi” in our pork banh mi bowl. Related: Shrimp Banh Mi Recipe A Different Way to Banh Mi Why go for a banh mi bowl instead of the classic, traditional sandwich? That’s easy! Bowls give us room to play with more flavors and textures. This also allows us to pile on more nutrients and reduce things like carbs. Feel free to pile on crunchy veggies like quick-pickled carrots and onion, cool cucumber slices, fresh cilantro leaves, and spicy jalapenos. Add your choice of lean protein – maybe shredded chicken, beef, or tofu. Then, top it off with a little sriracha for an extra layer of heat! With every bite, you’ll get a party of textures and nutrients. Ditch the bread – this banh mi bowl celebrates vegetables in all their glory. So grab a fork, my friend, and let’s dig into something delicious! Ingredients Needed for this Pork Banh Mi Bowl Below are the ingredients we chose to use in our pork banh mi bowls. But you can always modify our recipes to better suit your preferences! Feel free to omit or add whichever ingredients you wish. We’ll recommend some additional ingredients in the FAQ section! Olive oil Pork shoulder Asian five spice Ginger Chicken broth Sweet potatoes Garlic Red onion Carrots Red wine vinegar Baby spinach Cilantro Jalapenos Sriracha If you choose to add any unique ingredients, be sure to tell us about it in the comment section! We’re always open to new ideas and suggestions! How to Make a Banh Mi Bowl There are several steps to this recipe however they’re all relatively simple (and the end result will be well worth it!) Begin by getting out your instant pot! Add one tablespoon of olive oil and set it to saute. Next, season your pork shoulder with Asian five spice, salt, and pepper. Saute each piece of pork shoulder until browned on all sides, about 10 minutes total. When you’re finished, set it aside. Switch the instant pot from saute to pressure cook, turn it on high, and set the timer for 45 minutes. Place the rack inside the instant pot and add your pork and ginger. Pour the chicken broth in the bottom and seal the lid. Set

items.title: Baked Feta Sticks with Hot Honey Dip
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Cuisine » Mediterranean » Baked Feta Sticks with Hot Honey Dip Mediterranean Baked Feta Sticks with Hot Honey Dip 5 from 1 vote by Giorgio Pintzas Monzani Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 137 Published: July 25, 2023 Transport your taste buds to the Mediterranean shore! Wouldn’t it be wonderful if you could transport yourself to the sun soaked shores of Greece without having to leave the comfort of your own home? Well thanks to our baked feta sticks with hot honey dip – now you can! This recipe is made with authentic Mediterranean ingredients and offers flavors that will satisfy your craving for Greek cuisine. Suitable for lunch, dinner, or even your next cocktail party, you can enjoy this simple recipe any time of day! Table of Contents Watch Chef Giorgio Make These Baked Feta Sticks in Greece! Ingredients You Need How to Make Baked Feta Sticks with Hot Honey Dip Frequently Asked Questions What other types of cheese can be used to make cheese sticks? Is this baked feta recipe good without hot honey dip? Are these baked feta sticks with hot honey dip healthy? Can the baked feta sticks with hot honey dip be made ahead of time? What can I serve these feta sticks with? Want to Watch Instead of Read? Related Recipes Watch Chef Giorgio Make These Baked Feta Sticks in Greece! Ingredients You Need The combination of ingredients in these baked feta sticks with hot honey dip were chosen with care. Our selections provide the perfect trio of flavors, textures, and nutrients! Let’s take a closer look at the stars of this show. Feta Cheese : This ingredient offers a salty, creamy base for the crunchy baked bread crumbs to stick to. And in addition to the distinct tangy flavor and gooey texture that the feta cheese provides, it’s also a great source of protein and calcium. Just make sure you buy a block for this recipe and not crumbles! Bread Crumbs : We used plain bread crumbs and added our own seasonings (thyme and paprika) but feel free to use any kind of breadcrumbs you’d like. Italian style breadcrumbs would be delicious in this recipe! You can buy it or make your own. Just add an equal amount of dried parsley, basil, and oregano, as well as onion powder, garlic powder, or even black pepper to your bread crumbs. If you opt for whole grain bread crumbs you will get a little more fiber, too! Regardless of which you choose, this ingredient will add the crunchy brown coating to your creamy feta sticks. Honey : Savory always needs a sweet companion, which is where honey comes in! Not only does it add to the taste, but honey contains many different vitamins and minerals, and is lower on the glycemic index than other sugary ingredient options. Red Chili Flakes : This ingredient is worth highlighting because it rounds out the flavor profile of this baked feta sticks with hot honey dip recipe. You have salty, sweet, and now– spicy! You can use red pepper flakes if that’s what you have or you’d like it to be a little less spicy. How to Make

items.title: Garlic Ginger Pork Stir Fry
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Garlic Ginger Pork Stir Fry Recipes Garlic Ginger Pork Stir Fry 5 from 1 vote by SkinnyMs. Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 241 Published: July 22, 2023 Last Updated: August 28, 2024 Kick bland and boring weeknight meals to the curb. Thinking about ordering takeout? Skip it! Try our garlic ginger pork stir fry, instead! Made with an msg-free homemade sauce, fresh veggies, and lean, boneless pork, it’s a much healthier option. Plus, this dish will be ready to enjoy in about half an hour– and you won’t have to drive to pick it up or pay a delivery fee! Our pork stir fry certainly isn’t the same old bland weeknight meal. This dish is packed with flavor and you can make it as spicy as you want (my favorite part about stir fry recipes). You can always throw in some udon, Hokkien, or other stir fry noodles for a more authentic takeout experience, as well. The Basics of Stir Fry Cooking There’s a reason stir-frying is such a popular way to cook throughout Asia — all you need is one pan and some fire. This traditional Chinese cooking technique usually makes use of a wok, which has a strategic shape. The bowl-shaped cooking vessel gets the most heat on the bottom for ingredients that need to be cooked at high temperatures, and the ingredients that can be cooked at lower temperatures can be pushed up to the sides. The tall sides of the wok allow you to stir the ingredients quickly without spilling. For cooking at home, the flat-bottomed woks are ideal because they fit well on both electric and gas stovetops. I used a flat-bottomed wok for this recipe, but you can use a regular pan if that’s all you have — you’ll just want to make sure it’s big enough to fit all the ingredients. While I love the ingredients in this stir fry, there are a variety of veggies and proteins you can use to make a great stir fry. You just need to know the order in which to add certain ingredients because some cook faster than others. The gist of it goes like this: Protein first: You can use pretty much anything, including chicken, pork, beef, tofu, seafood, seitan, or tempeh. Veggies next: Almost anything goes so feel free to mix it up! Aromatics last: Classic stir fry aromatics include ginger, garlic, shallots, green onions, etc… The Magic is in The Sauce The key to a good stir fry is the sauce. Without the sauce, you just have sauteed meat and veggies — that doesn’t count as a stir fry. With this garlic ginger pork stir fry recipe — or any recipe for that matter — you’ll want to prepare your sauce ahead of time. Doing so will ensure that it’s added at the perfect time. This is the ‘aromatics’ part of the stir-fry equation, and for ours, we used soy sauce, pineapple juice, honey, ginger, and garlic. Yum! You can also add a little cornstarch if you want a thicker sauce that coats the meat and veggies. Simply whisk the sauce ingredients together in a bowl or shake them up in a jar. items.title: Roasted Cod with Asparagus and Tomatoes
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Diet Type » Low-Carb » Roasted Cod with Asparagus and Tomatoes Low-Carb Roasted Cod with Asparagus and Tomatoes No ratings yet by Chef Sallie Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 22 Published: July 20, 2023 Last Updated: December 6, 2024 You have to try this low-carb, one-pan wonder! Our recipe for roasted cod with asparagus and tomatoes is a wholesome and satisfying meal that will please your taste buds and nourish your body. It combines tender, flaky cod with crisp asparagus and juicy tomatoes that have been seasoned and roasted to perfection. Sometimes simple is best, and this nutritious and delicious recipe will prove it! So, let’s take a closer look at this low-carb, one-dish wonder! What Do I Need to Make this Fish and Vegetable Recipe? This roasted cod with asparagus and tomatoes doesn’t need much in terms of ingredients. Here are the few things that you will need: Wild cod Asparagus Grape tomatoes Dried oregano Olive oil And of course some salt and pepper! How Do I Make Roasted Cod with Asparagus and Tomatoes? When we say this recipe is simple, we mean it! Start by preheating your oven to 375 degrees F. We want it nice and hot to get this fish perfectly roasted! Place the cod filets and veggies on a sheet pan—be sure they’re in a single layer so everything cooks evenly. Now the fun part: sprinkle on some salt, pepper, and oregano. The oregano will give it a delicious Mediterranean flair! Finally, drizzle on some olive oil to get everything glistening. Pop it in the oven and roast for about 20 minutes, until the fish is so tender it flakes apart with just a fork. The wait is torture but so worth it! Pull it out of the oven and serve immediately. The aromas will have everyone running to the table! Frequently Asked Questions If you’ve never roasted fish before, you might have some questions on the preparation process! Here are some of the most commonly asked questions. If you don’t see the answer you’re looking for, please leave your question in the comment section and we’ll get back to you asap! What type of cod should I use for this recipe? You can use any variety of cod filets, such as Atlantic cod or Pacific cod. Fresh or frozen cod works well, just be sure to thaw it first if using frozen. Thawing frozen fish overnight in the fridge is the safest way to do so! Can I use other types of fish instead of cod? You sure can! You can substitute cod with other white fish varieties like haddock, halibut, or tilapia. Can I add additional vegetables to the dish? Absolutely! Feel free to customize this recipe by adding other vegetables such as bell peppers, brussels sprouts, zucchini, or mushrooms to the roasting pan for added nutrients and flavor! Can I prepare this roasted cod with vegetables in advance? While roasted cod with asparagus and tomatoes is best enjoyed fresh from the oven, you can prepare the components ahead of time and assemble them just before roasting for convenience. Store the seasoned cod, prepped asparagus

items.title: How to Make Crispy Cheese Taco Shells
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » How to Make Crispy Cheese Taco Shells Recipes How to Make Crispy Cheese Taco Shells No ratings yet by Kelsey Butler, MS, RDN Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 134 Published: July 8, 2023 Just when you thought tacos couldn't get any yummier! Looking for a new and exciting way to serve your favorite taco recipe? You’ve come to the right place! We’ll show you how to make crispy cheese taco shells! T hey’re an awesome and flavor-packed substitute for plain old flour or corn tortillas! And in addition to being savory and delicious, these cheese taco shells are actually good for you! E asy to make with just a few simple ingredients, this recipe is sure to become a new family favorite for taco night! Table of Contents Perfect Solution for Low-Carb Diets Nutritional Benefits of Cheese Types of Cheese to Use for These Tacos How to Make Crispy Cheese Taco Shells Preheat Arrange Bake Cool Shape Enjoy A Note on Storage and Freezing Taco Recipes to Try These Cheese Taco Shells American Taco Recipes Mexican-Inspired Recipes Asian Taco Ideas Caribbean Flavors Frequently Asked Questions More Taco-ish Recipes Perfect Solution for Low-Carb Diets We all love tacos, but they can be difficult to fit into a low-carb or ketogenic diet . Learning how to make crispy cheese taco shells is the perfect, low-carb-diet-friendly answer! They are cheesy, crunchy, and great for any taco recipe. Coming in at just one gram of carbs per serving, this recipe fits the bill for anyone trying to reduce their carb intake. And even better? You don’t have to sacrifice flavor to do so! But these crispy cheese taco shells aren’t just low in carbs. They’re also a good source of protein and healthy fats (especially when compared to flour or corn tortillas.) Protein is essential to maintaining and building muscle, as well as boosting your metabolism. Fat works to keep you feeling fuller for longer so you’re less inclined to overeat! All good things! Nutritional Benefits of Cheese The beauty of this recipe is that it calls for just one simple ingredient– cheese! And because it’s the star of this show, we thought it deserved some extra attention! Did you know that in moderation, cheese can actually be really good for you? Let’s take a closer look at the nutrients (other than protein and fat) that you can get from eating these single-ingredient crispy cheese taco shells! Calcium This affordable dairy product is packed with calcium, a crucial nutrient. You’ve probably heard that calcium strengthens your bones, nails, and teeth– preventing osteoporosis, but did you know that it also corrects mineral and hormonal imbalances and relieves symptoms of PMS? Calcium can even fight cancer and diabetes. It also helps regulate your blood pressure when combined with vitamin D (also found in cheese). Probiotics Certain high-fat cheeses like cheddar (recommended for this recipe), brie, and bleu cheese also contain conjugated linoleic acid (CLA) , which reduces your risk of obesity and h

items.title: Deluxe Cheeseburger Bowl
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Dish Type » Bowls » Deluxe Cheeseburger Bowl Bowls Deluxe Cheeseburger Bowl 5 from 1 vote by Chef Sallie Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 102 Published: July 6, 2023 Last Updated: December 6, 2024 Everything you love about burgers (without the excess carbs!) I love cheeseburgers. But the sad reality is that the bun – or at least the carbs in the bun – don’t love me back. As a private chef, and as someone with dietary restrictions myself, I’ve had to take the foods that my clients and I love to eat, and make adjustments so that I/we can still enjoy them. Think you have to give up cheeseburgers because you’re watching your carbs? Not so, my dear friends. Experience all of the wonderful elements of a juicy, tasty cheeseburger (minus the carbs) in this yummy deluxe cheeseburger bowl. The Best of Both Worlds Behold, the deluxe cheeseburger bowl! You can still enjoy your favorite toppings, without the hit on your blood glucose or any unpleasant side effects often caused by consuming a fast-food cheeseburger. Love grilled onions and bacon? No problem. Gooey cheese your thing? Unless you have a lactose issue, or are watching your fat consumption, go for it! While you’re at it, pile on some delicious, nutritious veggies to get those vitamins and fiber you won’t often get visiting a typical burger drive-thru. Ready? Here we go! You’ll thank me later. Gather Up Your Ingredients and Get Cooking! Begin by combining the mayonnaise, yellow mustard, and Dijon mustard in a small bowl. Cook four slices of bacon in a skillet until crispy. Reserve the bacon fat in the skillet. Let the bacon cool before chopping it into little bits. Now for the beef – use 1 pound of 90/10 beef or leaner. 93/7 is usually the leanest you will find at the grocery store. Season it with salt and black pepper and then cook the beef in the reserved bacon fat until it’s fully browned. Drain the excess grease and set the beef aside. Next up, melt the butter in the skillet and sauté a thinly sliced onion until translucent. Then, dice the tomato, chop your dill pickle chips into rough pieces, and shred the cheddar cheese. Now we’ve got all the fixings for these sensational cheeseburger bowls! Divide the spinach evenly between 4 bowls and top with ground beef. Add the onion, tomato, pickles, cheese, bacon, and finally the dressing you made at the beginning. Note: thousand island dressing is similar to McDonald’s Big Mac sauce – you can try that instead of making your own if you’d like! Choose Your Own Toppings Who says the deluxe cheeseburger bowl has to include bacon, or spinach (Romaine would be nice and crisp!)? Try swapping out different ingredients and tailor the bowl to your liking! You can add/omit pretty much any burger topping that you wish! This burger bowl leaves a lot of room for creativity! Here’s a list of some unique and popular toppings: Avocado or guacamole Mushrooms (sautéed or grilled) Fried egg Jalapeños Banana Peppers Relish Barbecue sauce Garlic Aio

items.title: Spicy Black Bean Hummus
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Meal Type » Appetizers » Spicy Black Bean Hummus Appetizers Spicy Black Bean Hummus No ratings yet by Chef Sallie Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 986 Published: July 1, 2023 Last Updated: July 10, 2023 Homemade is SO MUCH BETTER than store-bought! Move aside, plain hummus! Our spicy black bean hummus offers tasty southwest flavors that will keep you coming back for more! This versatile hummus recipe can be enjoyed in many different ways! It’s perfect as a weekday snack , party appetizer , or even as a condiment ! And it’s also worth mentioning that this hummus is as nutritious as it is delicious! Loaded with protein and fiber, but low in fat and calories, this is a snack you can feel good about. So ditch the store-bought dips and give this homemade spicy black bean hummus a try! Your taste buds will thank you! Table of Contents Spicy Hummus Ingredients How to Make Spicy Black Bean Hummus Serving Suggestions How to Properly Store Your Leftovers Frequently Asked Questions Similar Black Bean Recipes Watch Instead of Read Spicy Hummus Ingredients This spicy black bean hummus is made with just a few simple, plant-based ingredients, many of which you probably already have on hand. This perfect medley of beans, sauces, and seasonings is designed to maximize flavor as well as health benefits. Let’s take a closer look at each i ngredient. Main Ingredients Black Beans – Packed with protein, fiber, and antioxidants (which prevent cancer), black beans can do so many things! They help manage blood pressure, lower cholesterol, prevent diabetes, and even fend off heart disease. They’re known to promote weight loss and healthy digestion and are remarkably low in calories. Mild in flavor, black beans are used in various cuisines and can be added to almost any meal or snack–even brownies ! Lime Juice – Not only does it provide a zingy flavor, but lime can also boost your immune system. Furthermore, it is linked to the prevention of heart disease and kidney stones, helps you absorb iron, and even makes your skin glow. This nutritional powerhouse of a fruit is packed with vitamin C and antioxidants, as well as other nutrients like calcium, vitamin B6, iron, thiamine, and potassium. Tahini – Made from ground sesame seeds, tahini is packed with protein. This means the black beans aren’t the only excellent protein source in this filling snack. Tahini is also rich in fiber, copper, phosphorus, and selenium. This miracle paste reduces the risk of heart disease, inflammation, and even cancer. Spices Cumin – Not only does this spice have anticancer and anti-inflammatory properties, but it also fights bacteria and parasites, lowers cholesterol, promotes weight loss, controls blood sugar levels, and is even used to treat illnesses like diarrhea and IBS. Cumin also stimulates the nervous system, which sharpens your memory and motor skills . Coriander – Rich in antioxidants, coriander provides a boost to your immune system. It’s good for your skin, he

items.title: Loaded Baked Potato Salad
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Cuisine » American » Loaded Baked Potato Salad Recipes Loaded Baked Potato Salad 5 from 2 votes by Kelsey Butler, MS, RDN Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 89 Published: June 24, 2023 This delicious dish is the perfect summer side! Turn this restaurant classic into a big, delicious salad! Our loaded baked potato salad is packed with tasty ingredients and fulfilling energy to keep you satisfied all day long. It’s a great recipe to make ahead of time because it’s easy to pack and the flavor gets better and better the longer it blends. So prepare this salad today for delicious lunches all week! Simple Chilled Salad Our loaded baked potato salad is the perfect cool and crisp dish for hot days. It can also be served as an excellent side salad to pair with grilled meats at your next barbecue. Personally, I like this recipe as a quick lunch option to prepare at the beginning of the week. No need to heat it up, so I can grab and go whenever I need! Benefits of Baked Potatoes For some reason, potatoes got a bad rep in the past. Lucky for you, we’re here to bust the myth that potatoes are bad for you. Potatoes are high in fiber as well as important vitamins and minerals such as iron and vitamin B and C. They’re also a great source of potassium, which is an excellent nutrient for post-exercise recovery and muscle soreness. For this recipe, we recommend baking your potatoes in the oven. However, you can also make your baked potatoes in the slow cooker during the day by following this Slow Cooker Baked Potato recipe! Toss Up This Loaded Baked Potato Salad Start by making the potatoes. Preheat the oven to 400° F and place the cleaned red potatoes on a baking sheet. Poke them with a fork 4 or 5 times to let the steam out while baking. Drizzle and coat the potatoes with olive oil. Then, place them in the oven and bake for about 45 minutes, or until they’re soft and easy to pierce with a fork. Let the potaotes cool and then cut them into quarters. Add the sliced potatoes to a large bowl, then drizzle apple cider vinegar over top and let them sit. Meanwhile, m ix the lemon juice, mayonnaise, Greek yogurt, salt, and pepper in a bowl to create the dressing. Add the dressing to the bowl with the potatoes, then top with radish, red onion, dill, green onion, cheddar cheese, and slivered almonds. Toss and serve over a bed of lettuce. 5 from 2 votes Loaded Baked Potato Salad This recipe is packed with tasty ingredients and fulfilling energy to keep you satisfied all day long. Review Recipe PIN RECIPE Print Recipe Cook Time 1 hour hour Cooling Time 15 minutes minutes Total Time 1 hour hour 15 minutes minutes Yield 8 people Serving Size 0.5 cup Course Lunch, Main Course, Salad, Side Dish Cuisine American Author Kelsey Butler, MS, RDN Review Recipe PIN RECIPE Print Recipe Ingredients US Customary – Metric 4 pounds baby potatoes quartered 1 tablespoon olive oil 3 tablespoons apple cider vinegar 1 tablespoon lemon juice 3/4 cup olive oil mayonnaise 3/4

items.title: Banana Pudding Ice Cream
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Cuisine » American » Banana Pudding Ice Cream Recipes Banana Pudding Ice Cream 5 from 2 votes by Eric O'Grey Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Share 1.4k Published: June 18, 2023 Last Updated: June 18, 2024 You won't believe that this ice cream is dairy-free! If you have a hard time believing that simple, delicious desserts can also vegan , gluten-free, and oil free healthy foods, you’ve gotta try this one. You won’t believe how delicious this banana pudding ice cream tastes, and how the consistency is so close to ice cream! Even better – all you need is a blender and a handful of ingredients. We’ll come back to talk about the blender in a minute, but I want to take a second to celebrate the simplicity of this dairy-free ice cream. It only has three ingredients, which not only means that it will be quick and easy to make, but it also means that it’s actually a healthy dessert option. How great is that! Yes – Only Three Ingredients First, you start with the bananas. Look for the ripest bananas possible – brown and black spots are welcomed. That’s because riper bananas make a more flavorful ice cream. When they ripen, the starches convert into sugars. Make sure it’s nice and ripe before you freeze it because the ripening process stops when it hits the freezer. Puree with almond milk once the bananas are fully frozen (they’ll need at least 12 hours). The almond milk will hydrate the starchy molecules from the banana and create an ice cream-like consistency. You may need a little more or less almond milk depending on the size of your bananas. Slowly drizzle it in until you’re satisfied. Then, top them off as you wish! We love a handful of chopped walnuts, but you could use any nut you have in the pantry. This ice cream is good when enjoyed with a spoon, but it’s truly amazing when combined with these muffins . Crumbing the muffins into the ice cream (or using the ice cream to “frost” the muffins) is a sure-fire way to convert anyone to a plant-based diet! A High-Speed Blender Okay, I promised that I would talk about the blender. You can totally use a standard blender to make this recipe…but it just won’t be as good. Regular blenders just don’t get enough speed to deliver the smooth, frozen results you want. I recommend opting for a high-speed blender (m y favorites are: Vitamix , Blendtec , and KitchenAid models). Once you have that high-speed blender, the doors will really open for you. In addition to this dairy-free ice cream, these blenders make the best cashew cheese (another dairy-free delight). They’re also a great way to start your day, because you can make all kinds of dairy-free smoothies with these things! Now that you know all about this incredible 3-ingredient banana pudding ice cream, you should totally whip up a batch! We can’t wait to hear what you think about this gluten-free, plant-based recipe. Let us know in the comments your favorite ways to enjoy this vegan ice cream. 5 from 2 votes Banana Pudding Ice Cream All y

items.title: Balsamic Fig Chicken Breasts
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Meal Type » Dinner » Balsamic Fig Chicken Breasts Dinner Balsamic Fig Chicken Breasts No ratings yet by Kelsey Butler, MS, RDN Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 160 Published: June 17, 2023 Enjoy this sweet and savory chicken for lunch or dinner (or both!) These balsamic fig chicken breasts are one of our favorite recipes to meal prep for lunch or serve for family dinner. Bursting with tangy, sweet, savory flavor, they make a protein-packed and healthy main course. Plus, they’re so versatile–you can serve them with almost any side dish and for any occasion. If you’re looking for a healthy way to jazz up your usual chicken dinner, this recipe is for you. It takes simple baked chicken breast to a whole new level! Table of Contents Why You’ll Love Balsamic Fig Chicken Breasts Chicken Breast and Weight Loss Ingredients Used How to Make Balsamic Fig Chicken Breasts Serving Suggestions Leftovers and Storage Frequently Asked Questions Similar Chicken Recipes Why You’ll Love Balsamic Fig Chicken Breasts Made with simple ingredients like boneless, skinless chicken breast, onion, garlic, balsamic vinegar, and fig preserves, this delicious chicken recipe is sure to be a hit with the whole family. Packed with 36 grams of lean protein and only 311 calories per serving, it’s the ultimate way to stay full and build muscle without sacrificing flavor. This chicken works with just about any side– green beans , brussels sprouts , cauliflower rice , quinoa , a colorful salad , or even these garlic parmesan puffs . It’s the perfect way to elevate your meal while still satisfying the pickiest of eaters. Figs and balsamic vinegar are the dream team–they balance each other out perfectly to create a sweet, tangy sauce that’s good for you too. Figs are rich in antioxidants and promote digestive health, while balsamic vinegar is proven to lower cholesterol and stabilize blood pressure. Combined with the classic lean protein from the chicken breast, it’s the ultimate tasty healthy meal. Chicken Breast and Weight Loss Chicken breast is the ultimate lean protein, and eating it regularly should help you along on your weight loss journey (as long as you prepare it in a healthy way). It’s relatively low in fat (about 5g per cup) and calories (about 231 calories per cup) and impressively high in protein (about 43 grams per cup). This sweet spot means it’ll keep you fuller longer while helping you stay in a caloric deficit. It also provides a boost for your metabolism and will help you maintain muscle mass. If you’re looking for healthy sources of protein, chicken breast and other white cuts of chicken are your best bet (stay away from darker, more caloric cuts like chicken thighs and drumsticks). This is especially true for picky eaters, as chicken breasts are pretty universally beloved. However, it’s also crucial that you prepare your chicken breast in new and exciting ways so you don’t get bored with your new healthy diet. It’s a common stereotype that w

items.title: Air Fryer Steak Bites
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Method » Air Fryer » Air Fryer Steak Bites Air Fryer Air Fryer Steak Bites No ratings yet by Kelsey Butler, MS, RDN Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 453 Published: June 10, 2023 Last Updated: June 22, 2023 The easiest way to prepare protein-packed steak bites! These protein-packed air fryer steak bites are bursting with flavor and take less than 15 minutes to prepare. Tender and seasoned to perfection, these steak cubes are crowd-pleasing and pair perfectly with a variety of side dishes. If you need a quick entrée, appetizer, or companion for your next potluck or barbecue, this healthy recipe has you covered. Table of Contents Why You’ll Love Air Fryer Steak Bites Steak, Protein, and Weight Loss Pre-Workout Fuel or Post-Workout Recovery How to Make Air Fryer Steak Bites Best Sauces for Air Fryer Steak Serving Suggestions Side Dishes Using the Same Cooking Method Frequently Asked Questions Can You Cook Raw Steak in an Air Fryer? What Cut of Steak is Best for Air Frying? Will an Air Fryer Make Meat Dry? What Setting Should I Put My Air Fryer on for Steak? Do I Need to Flip Steak in the Air Fryer? Does Air Frying Make Steak Healthier? What’s the Best Way to Store Leftovers? More Air Fried Recipes to Try! Watch Instead of Read Why You’ll Love Air Fryer Steak Bites If you’re craving steak, there couldn’t be a quicker and easier way to prepare it than this. It’s one of the best-kept secrets of air fryer recipes–you can even make batches to enjoy leftovers later! All you need is steak (fat trimmed and cut up), olive oil, and the steak seasoning of your choice. Feel free to experiment and customize your own seasoning blend–whether it’s with simple salt and pepper, onion or garlic powder, rosemary, thyme, parsley, or a bolder spice like chile powder or paprika. These steak bites are delicious on their own or paired with a side dish like mashed or fingerling potatoes, roasted veggies, rice, or salad. You can serve them as an appetizer or bring them to your next family gathering to share. With 25 grams of protein per serving and far fewer calories and fat than traditionally cooked steak, it’s tough to top this recipe. Air fryers require little to no oil (they’re technically not fryers, but mini convection ovens that blow hot air around your food). This means you save on calories and fat without sacrificing texture and flavor– air fryer lovers rave about the crispy outside and moist inside they create. Steak, Protein, and Weight Loss When we think of steak, we don’t always think of lean protein . Chicken , tofu , and fish are more closely associated with muscle growth and weight loss. It’s true that eating too much red meat may be linked to a higher risk of diabetes, cancer, strokes, and heart disease. But eating steak in moderation can actually be quite beneficial for your health. Steak is incredibly rich in protein and iron, as well as other vitamins, minerals, and nutrients. It’s a great source of carnosine and creatine, which sup

items.title: Spicy Sriracha Tuna Wraps
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Spicy Sriracha Tuna Wraps Recipes Spicy Sriracha Tuna Wraps No ratings yet by SkinnyMs. Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 155 Published: May 30, 2023 Last Updated: August 28, 2024 A healthy, 10-minute lunch time option. If you’re looking for a high-protein, high-fiber wrap that’s quick and easy to make, look no further than these Spicy Sriracha Tuna Wraps! Made with just a few simple ingredients, they’re perfect for meal prep or a quick lunch on the go. Not to mention, they’re high in protein, fiber, and omega-3s, which are all important nutrients to keep you healthy and energized. Nutrient-Packed Wraps Tuna is a great source of protein, and these wraps also pack in the fiber with whole wheat tortillas and plenty of veggies. The sriracha adds a little spice, but you can always adjust the amount to taste. If you’re not a fan of tuna, feel free to substitute your favorite protein – chicken would also be great in these wraps. What is Sriracha? If you haven’t tried sriracha, pronounced (sir-rotch-ah), it’s a type of chili sauce that originates from Thailand. It’s made from sun-ripened chilies, garlic, vinegar, sugar, and salt, and has a slightly sweet, sour, and spicy flavor. Sriracha is often used as a condiment or dipping sauce, but it also adds a great flavor to these wraps. Super Easy Meal Prep This recipe comes together in just a few minutes, making it perfect for meal prep. Simply make the wraps ahead of time and store them in the fridge for grab-and-go lunches during the week. If you’re short on time, you can even use pre-made tuna salad from the grocery store. Just be sure to double-check the ingredients list to make sure it doesn’t have any unwanted add-ins like mayo or extra salt. How to Make These Sriracha Tuna Wraps These wraps can be made in just two simple steps! First, mix the tuna, celery, onion, mayo, greek yogurt, and sriracha in a large bowl, making sure to combine everything well. Then, assemble the wraps by layering the lettuce, tuna mixture, and tomatoes. Roll tightly, slice in half, and enjoy! You can even make these ahead of time and store them in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 4 days. Other Simple Wrapped Lunches If you’re looking for more easy wrapped lunch ideas, be sure to check out these recipes: Thai Chicken Wraps Southwest Veggie Wraps Feta Egg White Wrap with Spinach and Sundried Tomatoes Greek Turkey Wraps Skinny Chicken Bacon Ranch Wraps No ratings yet Spicy Sriracha Tuna Wraps This spicy sriracha tuna wraps are light and refreshing. They make the perfect lunch. items.title: Crispy Peanut Noodles
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Cuisine » Asian » Crispy Peanut Noodles Recipes Crispy Peanut Noodles 5 from 1 vote by Kelsey Butler, MS, RDN Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 204 Published: May 27, 2023 Savory noodles that are perfectly crispy and incredibly satisfying! Our vegan crispy peanut noodles are an easy-to-make dish that offers amazing nutty flavors and the perfect crispy texture. What’s more is that it’s ready in just 20 minutes! The many colorful vegetables in this recipe add lots of healthy antioxidants, while the peanuts pump up the protein and healthy fats. So, give this Asian restaurant swap a go tonight and let us know what you think! Chow Mein with a Twist Once again Skinny Ms. is coming at you with a deliciously healthy restaurant alternative– this time taking on the classic Chow Mein recipe. We’ve created our own simple peanut sauce as well as filled this dish with healthy veggies to pump up the nutrients. Ready in less than 20 minutes, our crispy peanut noodles are easy to make and just so delicious . Try this simple take-out alternative on your next busy night to recreate the Chinese favorite in your own kitchen. A Healthy Vegan Alternative This tasty, vegan-friendly recipe gets a healthy boost by combining fresh veggies like carrots, cabbage, bell pepper, and green onion with zesty ginger and fragrant garlic. You’ll be cooking this delicious, crunchy mixture in a small amount of sesame oil, which keeps the fat content down while boosting the nutrient density. Combining this antioxidant-rich bunch with a protein-filled peanut sauce and vitamin C-rich limes, vegans and non-vegans alike will be sure to hit their health goals with this dish. Crispy Noodles Ready in Minutes! First, you’ll need to cook the ramen noodles according to the package ingredients, then set them aside. Meanwhile, combine the peanut sauce ingredients in a medium bowl and set that aside as well. Once that is finished, heat the sesame oil in a large pan or wok over medium-high heat. Add the noodles and cook for about 8 minutes or until crispy and slightly browned, tossing occasionally. You may find that leaving the noodles to sit in an even layer for a minute or two at a time helps get an even crispier texture. Remove the noodles from the pan and toss the carrots, bell pepper, and cabbage into the pan, using the oils from the noodles to cook them. Sauté the veggies for 4 minutes or until softened, then add the noodles back in as well as the peanut sauce. Toss everything together and warm for about 1 minute, before removing the pan from the heat. Top with peanuts, green onion, and sesame seeds, serve with a lime wedge, and enjoy! 5 from 1 vote Crispy Peanut Noodles These yummy noodles are a great and healthy alternative to Chinese take-out! Review Recipe PIN RECIPE Print Recipe Prep Time 5 minutes minutes Cook Time 15 minutes minutes Total Time 20 minutes minutes Yield 4 people Serving Size 2 cups Course Dinner, Lunch Cuisine Asian, Chinese Author Kelsey Butler, MS

items.title: The Perfect Protein Muffins
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » The Perfect Protein Muffins Recipes The Perfect Protein Muffins No ratings yet by Kelsey Butler, MS, RDN Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 397 Published: May 20, 2023 Last Updated: November 7, 2023 A sweet treat that is good for you, too! What could be better than a muffin for breakfast? Maybe a protein-packed, fiber-rich muffin full of delicious flavors and healthy ingredients? If you’re looking for a new, simply sweet breakfast recipe to try, these Perfect Protein Muffins are a great way to get your day started off right! They’ll give you an awesome boost of energy and leave you fill satisfied. Table of Contents A Boost in Protein Pre-workout Fuel, Post-Workout Recovery Mix It Up Power Up With These Protein Muffins How to Serve These Protein Muffins Protein Muffin Commonly Asked Questions More Delicious Recipes A Boost in Protein Our Perfect Protein Muffins are a great way to pack in protein and fiber in the morning. Coming in at 10 grams of protein per muffin, this recipe is an excellent source of the important macronutrient. How do we get so much protein in a little muffin? Nearly every ingredient contains protein! Let’s take a closer look. Whole wheat flour contains more protein than all-purpose flour, which is most commonly used in baking. It’s an easy swap that we highly recommend! Of course, the protein powder itself adds the most protein to these tasty muffins. You can use your favorite powder– it really doesn’t matter which one. But we’ll get into that more in just a moment. Ingredients like egg whites and almond milk contribute to the protein content, as well. And then there is Greek yogurt. We love baking with Greek yogurt for two main reasons. Not only is it loaded with protein, but it adds a moist, creaminess to any recipe too! Pre-workout Fuel, Post-Workout Recovery The balance of protein and carbs in these perfect protein muffins makes them an excellent option for pre and post-workout nutrition. Carbohydrates provide quick energy, and protein helps to repair and rebuild your muscles. They will give your body the energy to get through your workout and are fantastic for refueling when your tank gets low! It’s just an added benefit that they taste so good . That said, they’re not only good before or after a workout. You can eat them as a healthy mid-morning or afternoon snack during the work day, or even as a dessert when your sweet tooth strikes. Send one to school with your kiddo in the morning for a healthy breakfast, or pack it in their lunch as a nutritious mid-day treat. It’s never the wrong time to indulge in a healthy, protein-packed muffin! Mix It Up While the recipe below is mighty tasty as is, we want you to feel free to switch it up to fit your preferences! You can make these muffins in a few different versions. Mix up the flavor of your protein powder for a new taste. Unsure of which protein powder to go for? Check out some of 7 Clean Protein Powders for Your Favorite Recipes . These muffins would

items.title: Spicy Eggplant Stir-Fry With Mushrooms
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Cuisine » Asian » Spicy Eggplant Stir-Fry With Mushrooms Recipes Spicy Eggplant Stir-Fry With Mushrooms No ratings yet by Alison Borel Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 221 Published: May 9, 2023 Craving take-out? Try this healthy and hearty, vegetarian dish instead! This spicy eggplant stir-fry with mushrooms has got your craving for Chinese take-out covered. We figured out how to cook that eggplant in significantly less oil to minimize saturated fat intake. By the same token, we added strips of portobello mushroom to mimic the umami provided by marinated beef. We’re pretty sure this meatless stir-fry is one for the ages and we hope you think so too. Microwaving Egg-Plant Cuts Cooking Time I’m not gonna lie, I like to use my microwave in a pinch, especially to prep veggies. The LA Times helped me figure out this hack and reading the science behind it is totally worth it. Anyway, in regard to eggplant, successful roasting typically requires high heat and much longer than I’d like to spend babysitting it, anywhere between 25 to 45 minutes. If you’re down for chopping off a major chunk of time spent waiting for one ingredient to cook, then try this. First, fill a microwave proof glass dish with the eggplant. Then, loosely cover it with a good fitting lid (also microwave proof). After that, cook for five minutes. By now, the eggplant should have somewhat, but not fully collapsed. If this is the case with yours, hit it for another three minutes. Side note: Older microwaves can take longer than newer models so you might need to add a few minutes if the magic doesn’t happen. Marinate Mushrooms To Mimic Meat The cool thing about marinades is that they easily transform into your finishing sauce at the end, making your two-fer into a one-time. In order to make this Sichuan style marinade accessible, I put together a list of ingredients most pantries already have. If you don’t have rice wine vinegar, then that’s an absolute must, and it’s easy to find. Mirin, an Asian rice wine, is also really nice, but not an absolute. Otherwise, we’re using: tamari (or soy sauce) honey Mirin (or white wine, Vodka, or nothing) garlic crushed red pepper black peppercorns (or black pepper) The mushrooms need at least 20 minutes to marinate, and you may do this well ahead of time if needed, up to a day. Also, don’t cut the gills off those portobellos, unless you really like taking extra steps in the kitchen. Today’s chefs really like to utilize the entire vegetable, in an effort to prevent waste. How To Finalize Spicy Eggplant Stir-Fry With Mushrooms Because the veggie stir-fry doesn’t take very long, and a cornstarch slurry sounds difficult, do not let this intimidate you. I actually prep my slurry well in advance so I’m not running to the pantry searching for the one thing I seldom use: cornstarch. If you make it well ahead (and by that I mean just adding a few tablespoons of cold water to cornstarch in a tiny bowl and stirring), you will be fine. W

items.title: Healthy Mexican Bean Dip
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Meal Type » Appetizers » Healthy Mexican Bean Dip Appetizers Healthy Mexican Bean Dip No ratings yet by Kelsey Butler, MS, RDN Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 176 Published: May 3, 2023 You might want to go ahead and start with a double batch because this dip will get gobbled up FAST! Step aside, salsa. There’s a new go-to appetizer in town! Our Healthy Mexican Bean Dip is chock-full of nutritious ingredients and amazing flavor. And did we mention you can whip it up in less than 20 minutes?! Whether you’re planning a party, or unexpected visitors drop by, you’ll be well prepared if you keep the ingredients for this yummy recipe on hand. A New Fiesta Favorite This creamy bean dip is one of my favorite things to make whenever I have a guests coming over or an event to attend. It’s so nice to have an option that’s healthier than a cheese dip and more exciting than plain old salsa. And in addition to being healthy and delicious, this bean dip is also super simple to prepare. Plus, I usually already have all of the ingredients on hand which makes it even easier! All you need to do is blend it up, and you’ve got a rich and creamy dip, ready to go! You can serve it right away or keep it in the fridge for up to one week in an airtight container. Serve It Up There are a number of ways to enjoy this healthy recipe! Serve up this bean dip with low-fat tortilla chips, Spicy Whole Grain Crackers, or even with our Plant-Based Cashew Flat Bread . For a low-carb option, try out some veggie sticks or baked cheese crackers. Additionally, if you end up with any leftover dip (slim chance when it’s this good!) you can spread it out on and wrap it up in a tortilla with some fresh veggies and baked chicken for a super easy and protein-rich burrito! If you use this healthy bean dip in a different way, be sure to let us know in the comment section! We always enjoy reading your creative ideas! High Protein Appetizer We used black beans in this vegetarian dip, not only because they are a staple in Mexican cuisine, but also because they provide lots of healthy nutrients. Fiber, iron, and protein are the three main players when it comes to black bean nutrition. Combining them with some non-fat Greek yogurt, which is high in protein, calcium, and vitamin D, ensures that this recipe is the perfect low-fat, low-carb dip for any occasion. The addition of lime juice and Mexican spices elevates the flavor profile further, without tacking on a bunch of excess calories. Once you serve this healthy appetizer, watch and wait for the smiles to spread. Your guests will love the flavor of this bean dip and will be shocked at how healthy it is! Get Ready to Impress Your Guests with this Appetizer To make this dish, start by placing your black beans in a food processor with Greek yogurt, lime juice, garlic powder, onion powder, cumin, oregano, paprika, and salt. Pulse the mixture until you end up with a mostly creamy consistency (a few chunks add texture to this r

items.title: Chipotle Chicken Tostadas
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Chipotle Chicken Tostadas Recipes Chipotle Chicken Tostadas 5 from 1 vote by SkinnyMs. Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 192 Published: April 29, 2023 Last Updated: May 18, 2023 Turn taco Tuesday into tostada Tuesday. Easy, quick, healthy, and delicious. What more can you ask for in a meal? We instantly fell in love with these chipotle chicken tostadas, and you will too! With healthier ingredients and cleaner cooking methods, this family-friendly meal is sure to keep you on track to your health goals. Plus, it tastes absolutely amazing, making it the perfect option for satisfying your Mexican food cravings. So Much to Love About the Tostada! Don’t get me wrong, I love tacos . But if I had known about tostadas sooner, I would have been making all of my taco recipes with them instead! A tostada is essentially an open-faced taco, except it doesn’t form into that taco shape — it stays flat. That’s because the tortilla is toasted, which is what “tostada” means in Spanish. However, in Mexico, the tortilla is traditionally fried in oil or fat to achieve that crunch. You can, by all means, do this for some extra flavor, but I chose to bake the tortillas to keep this dish on the healthier side. Baking is an excellent alternative to frying if you’re trying to keep calorie count and fat content in check. These chipotle chicken tostadas have so much flavor that you’ll hardly notice anyway. You’ll be calling it Tostada Tuesday from now on! Chipotle Chicken Tostada Tips & Tricks We chose to use lean ground chicken in this recipe because it’s super high in protein but low in fat. But because these chipotle chicken tostadas are made with ground chicken, you may have some issues with the chicken falling off the tostada. To solve this problem, you could put the lime crema between the tostada and the meat to help prevent the ground chicken crumbles from falling off when you take a bite. Or, you can add an extra ingredient altogether. For me, that extra ingredient is avocado if it’s in season. You can simply put the avocado filling in a bowl and use a fork to mash it into a creamy texture. Or you can make guacamole to enjoy on your tostadas and/or as a dip for tortilla chips. I make such an easy guacamole by simply adding shallots, tomatoes, lime, jalapeno, fresh cilantro, and salt to my avocado mix. Use however much of each ingredient you’d like to fit your preferences. Put this in between the ground chicken and tostada to hold it together. What if I Don’t Have Ground Chicken? Not everyone can find ground chicken or ground turkey in their local grocery store. But that doesn’t matter. There is no wrong way to make a tostada! Another healthy option is boneless, skinless chicken breasts. You can prepare it by combining the chicken breasts with the chipotle sauce, olive oil, and spices in a ziplock bag. Then allow it to marinate for at least an hour before grilling it or cooking it in a pan. Cut it into small chunks for your tostada, and there y

items.title: 4-Ingredient Cloud Bread
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Cuisine » American » 4-Ingredient Cloud Bread Recipes 4-Ingredient Cloud Bread No ratings yet by Kelsey Butler, MS, RDN Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 221 Published: April 25, 2023 This light and fluffy bread is what dreams are made of. Named after it’s cloud-like appearance, cloud bread is one of our favorite almost-no-carb bread options. It can be used in so many different ways! Here at Skinny Ms., we love to find recipes that fit everyone’s preferences, however, we know that not all replacements are the same. This 4-ingredient cloud bread is ultra-low-carb, gluten-free, and perfect for those on the keto or Atkins diet. It is light, fluffy, delicious, and surprisingly filling. Endless Possibilities The possibilities are endless with our fluffy cloud bread. You can use it for sandwiches, toast, muffins, pizza bases, for dipping, or even as a dessert with a sweet topping. There are just tons of options with this recipe! We don’t list any specific additions to our recipe, but you can add whatever you’d like to the base. Try mixing in fresh rosemary, ground cinnamon, or everything seasoning for some different flavors. Or, you can top this cloud bread with pizza sauce and toppings, berries and whipped cream, or hummus and veggies. Low-Carb Ingredients As mentioned above, this recipe is gluten-free, keto-friendly, and great for those looking for low-carb options. The main ingredient is protein-rich eggs, which are separated to get both rich flavor and fluffy texture. The yolk is combined with the cream cheese to hold this bread together and offer a rich, creamy flavor while the egg whites are whipped with cream of tartar and salt for the highest peaks of perfection. When combined, you get a delicious, cloud-like dish. How to “Whip” this Bread Up First, prep your oven by preheating it to 300 degrees Fahrenheit. Separate your eggs and place the egg yolks into a medium bowl. Add the cream cheese and beat it with a hand mixer until smooth. If you are including any seasoning in this recipe, I suggest you mix it in with the yolk and cream cheese at this time. In a separate medium bowl, add the egg whites, cream of tartar, and salt. Whip this mixture with a hand mixer, making sure to thoroughly clean the beaters if using the same one as the yolks. Continue to whip the egg whites until stiff peaks form. Gradually add the yolk mixture into the whites a little bit at a time, and gently fold it together until combined. Take a quarter-cup of the mixture and drop it onto a cookie sheet that has been lined with baking paper. Be sure to leave spaces between each dollop so that they don’t touch. Bake them for 15 to 20 minutes, or until they turn golden brown in color. You will know the bread is finished if the center of each piece doesn’t jiggle when moved. Allow your cloud bread to cool, then gently peel each round off the parchment paper. K eep in mind that this bread does not store very well so we suggest serving it immediately! No rati

items.title: Fresh and Creamy Cucumber Salad
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Dish Type » Salads » Fresh and Creamy Cucumber Salad Salads Fresh and Creamy Cucumber Salad 5 from 1 vote by Kelsey Butler, MS, RDN Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 2.3k Published: April 22, 2023 Last Updated: June 22, 2023 Enjoy Greek-inspired flavors in a crisp and refreshing way! Do you like tzatziki? If you do, then you’ll love this fresh and creamy cucumber salad! It’s inspired by the classic Greek recipe however we’ve made it even better by combining it with fresh veggies like cucumbers, tomatoes, and red onions! The result? Your new favorite salad! Enjoy it as a healthy lunch or serve it as a simple side dish for your next backyard cookout. Traditional Greek Dish Tzatziki is a traditional Mediterranean dish that is made with yogurt and cucumbers. It was originally used as a side or dip to hot and spicy rice dishes in order to offset the heat. Nowadays, this dish is well known for its flavor and refreshing qualities. We’ve taken the original ingredients and put our own spin on them to make a fresh and creamy salad that you can enjoy as a main or side. Cucumbers for Your Health! Cucumber is known for its hydrating, refreshing components, and the rumors are true! Cucumbers are made of 96% water, which in turn keep you hydrated when you eat them. They’re also a great source of other nutrients including potassium, vitamin K, and fiber, which are all essential for things like good digestion and cardiovascular health. Make this Fresh and Creamy Cucumber Salad Begin by preparing your vegetables. You’ll need to dice the cucumbers into half-inch (or smaller) pieces, slice your red onions, and chop your tomatoes into quarters. Add these veggies to a large bowl. In a separate medium-sized bowl, mix together the Greek yogurt, fresh dill, apple cider vinegar, sugar, salt, pepper, and garlic to make the creamy dressing. A quick note on the dill: Fresh herbs are always better both in taste and nutrition, however, you may use dried dill in this recipe if that’s all you have on hand. Once the sauce is well combined, pour it over top of the veggie mixture. Toss it until it’s completely covered. The colder this salad is, the better it will taste! If you’re not serving it right away, you’ll want to cover it and stick it in the fridge for an hour or so. If you’re serving it soon, try to give it at least a few minutes in the freezer to get it nice and cold! Perfect Pairings for Our Creamy Cucumber Salad Recipe Traditionally, cucumber and yogurt are served alongside spicy Indian and Mediterranean dishes. That pairing still works perfectly today. Serve this salad alongside some spicy dishes such as: Spicy Fish in Tomato Sauce Instant Pot Red Beans and Rice Stew Grilled Spicy Mediterranean Eggplant with Tomato Salad Slow Cooker Indian Chicken and Rice This awesome side dish would also shine at any backyard bbq or cookout! Try servings it alongside: Mediterranean Salmon Burger Keto-Friendly Flavor-Packed Turkey Burger Delicious Greek Chicken

items.title: Sheet Pan “Philly” Chicken
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Diet Type » Low-Carb » Sheet Pan “Philly” Chicken Low-Carb Sheet Pan “Philly” Chicken No ratings yet by Chef Sallie Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 65 Published: April 20, 2023 Last Updated: May 13, 2025 Enjoy the classic Philly flavors in a lower carb way! I absolutely love Philly cheesesteak! However, I’m sad to say the bread roll doesn’t love me anymore. Not to worry. I’ve landed on my feet and adapted to my new low carb lifestyle. I’ve got an easy way to make a fast, healthier version of the beloved sandwich, with a few minor changes! Allow me to introduce you to my sheet pan Philly chicken recipe. Peppers or No Peppers? That is the Question ! The peppers/no peppers controversy wages on. Philly Cheesesteak purists are adamant that peppers are not part of the traditional sandwich. I would have to agree with them, although I am not a native of the region that introduced the classic to the world. Maybe I only agree because I don’t like green peppers. Having said that, this recipe uses red and yellow peppers. Not because they are part of the traditional sandwich, but because it adds a pop of color, texture, and some additional nutrients as well. Got to Have Cheese Now let’s talk about the cheese. I prefer a creamy cheese sauce to drizzle over the top, but this recipe calls for sliced cheese for the sake of simplicity. I use a combination of American and Provolone. If you have a favorite cheese sauce recipe, by all means, use it (and share it with us in the comment section!) Let’s Get Cooking this Sheet Pan Philly Chicken First up, preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Then, slice one small yellow onion and one medium red and yellow pepper. Pop those onto a rimmed sheet pan. Next, thinly slice two pounds of chicken breast cutlets and add them to the veggies. Drizzle the whole mix with two tablespoons of olive oil and sprinkle on one teaspoon of garlic powder, half teaspoon of onion powder, one teaspoon of salt, and a fourth teaspoon of ground black pepper. Toss everything together until the chicken and veggies are evenly coated. Spread it all out in an even layer in the pan and bake for about 15 minutes, mixing and redistributing into an even layer about half way through. Remove the sheet pan Philly chicken from the oven and check for doneness. The chicken should have an internal temperature of 165 degrees F and the vegetables should be tender-crisp and slightly caramelized. Top the chicken and vegetables with your cheese slices (or other cheese sauce of choice) and return it to the oven for about 5 more minutes. Once the cheese is melted and bubbly, remove the sheet pan from the oven. Plate, serve, and enjoy! Must-Try (Healthier) Philly Cheesesteak Dinner is served! The combination of juicy chicken, crisp veggies, and gooey cheese makes this baked chicken dish an easy Philly-inspired winner. And I know – it isn’t technically Philly style with changes made. It does illicit an image in the mind though. The point is, recipes a

items.title: Slow Cooker Chicken Shawarma Sliders
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Meal Type » Appetizers » Slow Cooker Chicken Shawarma Sliders Recipes Slow Cooker Chicken Shawarma Sliders 5 from 1 vote by Kelsey Butler, MS, RDN Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 273 Published: April 18, 2023 Scrumptious sliders that are great as a party appetizer or main meal! If you’re preparing the menu for a summer gathering and want to serve something a little different, we’ve got the perfect recipe for you! There’s no grill required for this easy chicken dish– the slow cooker is all you need! In addition to being super simple to make, our slow cooker chicken shawarma sliders also taste amazing! They feature delightful flavors infused with healthy protein and a creamy, nutritious homemade sauce. The light yet savory flavors found in these sliders make them a great option for enjoying outdoors (but they’re just as good in the air conditioned kitchen, too!) Bringing Middle Eastern Flavors to Your Backyard Shawarma is one of the most popular dishes of southern Europe, western Asia, and northern Africa. It is frequently served as a convenient and delicious street food, particularly in Turkey, Egypt, and Pakistan. While it is usually served with lamb, mutton, or chicken, you can make it with veal, turkey, or beef as well. Once it’s coated with the delicious spices of the region, the meat is placed on a slow cooker and rotated consistently. This ensures that the flavors fuse perfectly with the protein. Naturally Healthy Shawarma’s fat and calorie levels depend on which meat is used. In the recipe below, we chose boneless, skinless chicken. Chicken will absorb the flavor perfectly without all the extra fat (unlike some of the other protein options). We use omega-3 packed olive oil, low amounts of salt, and a bit of coconut cream to balance out the vibrant spices. When adding our special Greek yogurt sauce, you get a fabulous compliment to the dish without driving up the calorie and fat content. The result is a delicious sandwich that helps dieters stay on track! Spice Up the Party Shawarma is all about flavor. And combining pepper, cumin, curry powder, paprika, tahini, and more with boneless chicken creates quite a bit of it! Once the chicken is done, you will balance out the intensity of the spices with our special Greek yogurt sauce. Serve the chicken up on the sliders of your choice, and enjoy! There will be plenty of backyard summer gatherings with burgers on the grill. Our chicken shawarma sliders recipe will make yours stand out above the rest! 5 from 1 vote Slow Cooker Chicken Shawarma Sliders Slow-cooked chicken and light, Greek yogurt sauce pair up to create simple and satisfying little sandwiches! Review Recipe PIN RECIPE Print Recipe Prep Time 5 minutes minutes Cook Time 3 hours hours Total Time 3 hours hours 5 minutes minutes Yield 6 people Serving Size 2 sliders Course Dinner, Main Course Cuisine Mediterranean Author Kelsey Butler, MS, RDN Review Recipe PIN RECIPE Print Recipe Ingredients US Customary – Metric

items.title: Loaded Veggie Pizza Chicken
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Loaded Veggie Pizza Chicken Recipes Loaded Veggie Pizza Chicken No ratings yet by Chef Sallie Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 35 Published: April 15, 2023 Last Updated: May 13, 2025 A classic pizza taste without the guilt and the grease! I love pizza, but unfortunately, my love affair with refined carbs has come to an end. Sometimes I crave the cheesy, melty, ooey-gooey goodness though. When those pizza cravings hit, I can rest a little easier knowing I can indulge in pizza without the guilt or negative side effects of the carbs. I give you our loaded veggie pizza chicken recipe! You can thank me later! Discovering a Guilt-Free Pizza Alternative Pizza has long held a special place in the hearts (and stomachs) of food lovers around the world. Its irresistible combination of gooey cheese, tangy tomato sauce, and a variety of delicious toppings is hard to resist. However, for some of us, the carb-heavy nature of traditional pizza can be a roadblock in our pursuit of a healthier lifestyle. Enter our loaded veggie pizza chicken recipe. This ingenious creation allows us to indulge in the flavors we love without the guilt or negative side effects of excessive carbohydrates. By replacing the traditional pizza crust with chicken breasts, we not only reduce the carb content but also increase the protein content, making this dish a nutritious option for those who want to satisfy their pizza cravings while still nourishing their bodies. Making this Pizza Chicken Your Own Season your chicken well with salt and pepper, before slathering on some marinara sauce. Add your toppings on after and you’re good to go! The beauty of loaded veggie pizza chicken lies in its versatility. This recipe serves as a delicious foundation for creativity and personalization. Don’t be afraid to experiment with different toppings and flavors to suit your preferences. Here are a few ideas to spark your imagination: Meat Lovers Paradise : For those who enjoy more protein options, consider adding cooked bacon bits, Italian sausage, sliced pepperoni, or even diced ham to your chicken breasts before layering on the marinara sauce and cheese. Mediterranean Delight : Give your pizza chicken a Mediterranean twist by topping it with feta cheese, sun-dried tomatoes, artichoke hearts, and a sprinkling of dried oregano and basil. Spicy Sensation : If you like things spicy, kick it up a notch by adding sliced jalapeños, crushed red pepper flakes, or a drizzle of hot sauce to your chicken breasts. Pair it with a cool side of creamy ranch or blue cheese dressing to balance the heat. Pleasure Without the Guilt As you take your first bite of loaded veggie pizza chicken, you’ll experience a melding of flavors and textures reminiscent of a classic pizza. The juicy chicken, slathered in tangy marinara sauce and smothered with melty cheese, provides a satisfying base for the crunchy vegetables and savory toppings. Each bite is a guilt-free pleasure that allows you to indulge in

items.title: Sesame Ginger Chicken Salad
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Sesame Ginger Chicken Salad Recipes Sesame Ginger Chicken Salad No ratings yet by SkinnyMs. Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 273 Published: April 11, 2023 Last Updated: August 28, 2024 Completely different flavors than what you're used to in a salad. If you’re like me, you have your go-to salad that you make almost every time. You pick up the same salad ingredients at the grocery store without even thinking about it. But, that can get boring so why not mix it up this time and try something new? Change up your salad game with this wildly flavorful Sesame Ginger Chicken Salad! Your tastebuds will thank you! I love this Sesame Ginger Chicken Salad because it has completely different flavors than what I’m used to in a salad. First, it has no lettuce, so it’s all veggies and no filler, which already makes it healthier and more nutrient-rich. And second, the homemade dressing ensures you’re skipping all those mystery ingredients typically included in store-bought dressing. What’s So Healthy About it? It starts with the ingredients: boneless, skinless chicken breasts, Napa cabbage , carrots, Persian cucumbers, green onions, toasted sesame seeds, sliced onions, and cilantro. Your body is going to love all those vitamins from the veggies and the protein from the lean meat. The dressing is made from scratch using sesame oil, low sodium soy sauce, rice vinegar, freshly grated ginger, and just a hint of maple syrup to balance out the acidity. I like to add some freshly chopped chiles or Sriracha for some extra heat. I always like to make my own salad dressings to avoid preservatives, artificial flavoring, and added refined sugars. Store-bought dressings tend to be loaded with calories, sodium, sugar, and saturated fats, not to mention those preservatives and stabilizers. Make Your Chicken More Flavorful While this recipe isn’t bland by any means, there are always ways to enhance the flavors of a recipe. For this sesame ginger salad recipe, I would recommend marinating the chicken if you have time. Do this by putting your boneless, skinless chicken breasts in a zipper-lock baggy and adding low sodium soy sauce, minced ginger, avocado oil, toasted sesame oil, rice wine vinegar, chopped green onions, and a little bit of sriracha (you won’t taste the spice much). It’s pretty much what you’ll use for the dressing, so the marinade is an extra flavor hit! Then seal your bag and let it marinate in the fridge for at least 30 minutes. I like to let it marinate for at least a couple of hours, though. You can either cook the chicken in the pan and finish it in the oven, or throw it on the grill on medium heat for a smokier flavor. What Else to Serve with Sesame Ginger Chicken Since this recipe already has plenty of veggies and protein, I like to serve it with just a little bread for some carbs. But you don’t really need to serve it with anything. It’s plenty filling. However, I do like to serve some dessert after if I’m having guests over. I don

items.title: Chocolate Yogurt Parfait
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Meal Type » Breakfast » Chocolate Yogurt Parfait Breakfast Chocolate Yogurt Parfait 5 from 1 vote by Kelsey Butler, MS, RDN Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 2.1k Published: April 1, 2023 Satisfy that early morning sweet tooth with this healthy parfait! Add a touch of sweetness to your morning routine with this chocolate yogurt parfait! It’s high in protein, fiber, and antioxidants, but also packs in some sweet, rich flavors. Make this single serving sweet parfait for a healthy and decadent breakfast, snack, or dessert today! You won’t be disappointed . Craving a Sweet Breakfast? If you’re like me, you like to switch it up in the mornings. Somedays I want sweet and some days I want savory. On sweet days, though, this chocolate yogurt parfait does the trick! It’s rich, creamy yet crunchy texture and decadent flavor really brightens my mornings. Perfectly paired with a nice cup or tea or coffee, this parfait can kickstart your morning while satisfying your sweet tooth. Not only is it just simply delicious, but it’s packed with healthy nutrients, too! Nutrient Packed Parfait This parfait is made with tasty and healthy ingredients! Greek yogurt, known for its delicious creamy texture, is high in protein. Eating a high protein breakfast can boost meal satiety and keep you fuller for longer. It also supports muscle growth and cellular function. Greek yogurt is a great source of calcium as well, which is important for bone health. On top of that, granola is a great way to get whole grains into your diet. It is high in fiber, B vitamins, and iron. Just make sure you grab a whole grain version at the supermarket. And we can’t forget about the chocolate! Cocoa powder alone has some awesome benefits! The Many Benefits of Chocolate Chocolate is a nutrient-rich, antioxidant-packed food. Antioxidants in chocolate have been shown to have the potential to reduce cardiovascular issues, cognitive decline, and cholesterol. New research has even begun to review chocolate’s beneficial effects on aging and conditions, such as inflammation, hypertension, and atherosclerosis. This is wonderful news for many of us chocolate lovers! Sweet & Simple Make this five-ingredient, single serving parfait in two simple steps! Start by mixing the Greek yogurt with cocoa powder in a bowl. You can use plain yogurt or vanilla yogurt here, depending on how you want it to taste. Plain will be more tart, while vanilla will give you a sweeter parfait. You can also use whole, low fat, or no fat Greek yogurt for this recipe. Whichever works best for you! Once you’ve got your chocolate yogurt ready, start stacking! In a bowl or cup, add a layer using half of the Greek yogurt, then half of the granola, and then half of the berries. Repeat these layers once more, then top with chocolate chips. Serve immediately or place in the fridge for later! 5 from 1 vote Chocolate Yogurt Parfait Make this sweet and healthy single-serving parfait in two simple steps! Review Recipe PI
